To bolster their financial capacities, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second loan. The previous loan was correctly repaid. This group of women does commerce in condiments, shoes, wheat flour, clothing, etc.

HABY, who is the first person from the right in the photo, buys and sells wheat flour from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail at the market, at the surrounding village fairs, and at home. Her customer base is composed of men and women.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used for investing in her business and repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour to resell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Benkadi est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  majoritairement dans des  familles nucléaires à Torakabougou, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures,  de condiments, d’habits, etc.
AWA,  deuxième de la droite vers la gauche,  fait l’achat vente de chaussures.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150 paires de chaussures auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché, dans les foires des villages environnants  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of five women who are all married. They average 33 years of age and four children each, living for the most part in nuclear families in Torakabougou, a district in Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacities, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan. This group of women does commerce in shoes, condiments, clothing, etc.

AWA, who is the second person from the right in the photo, buys and sells shoes. She plans on using her loan to purchase 150 pairs of shoes from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail at the market, at the surrounding village fairs, and at home. Her customer base is composed of men and women.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used for investing in  her business and repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Doña luisa tiene 44 años de edad en una relación de unión libre y madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven en casa y dependen de ellos en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario cursado hasta el 3 grado y se dedica la cultivo y siembra de café desde toda la vida siendo sus padres agricultores y los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. Las tierras que trabajan son propias y en las actividades del campo solo ella y su esposo se involucran en cuanto al mantenimiento y asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café como ser: limpieza, corte, fertilización, riego, entre otros.

Ella actualmente quiere evitar un daño a sus cultivos los cuales hasta el momento van muy bien si contaminación de plagas o enfermedades como la roya y lo que necesita es fertilizarla y abonarla ya que eso mantendrá segura y fuerte tanto la planta como el grano. 

Sus planes para el futuro es tecnificar sus cultivos para mantener una mejor producción, un mejor y seguro grano para su venta ya que de esa forma podrá dar a sus hijos una excelente educación mediante los ingresos de la venta del café.
texts.en:
Luisa is 44 years old, married, and the mother of two children who live at home and depend on her and her husband for everything. She has a third-grade education and has farmed and planted coffee for her whole life, as her parents are farmers and it was them who taught her to work the land. The lands that she works are her own and when it comes to tending the land, only she and her husband are involved in the maintenance of the coffee crops such as cleaning, cutting, fertilizing, irrigating, etc.

She now wants to avoid harm to her crops, which, so far, are doing well, in case of plagues or plant illnesses such as pests, and she needs to fertilize and put down compost because this will keep her crops as safe and strong, both the plants and the beans.

Her plans for the future is to make her farming more technical to maintain better production and a better and more secure bean for sale because this is how she will be able to give her children an excellent education through income from coffee sales.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and compost for farming coffee.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de 40 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Bertha, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores a los que cuida en la casa que heredo de sus padres hace 20 años.Desde niño aprendió a sembrar y criar animales. De ahí decidió estudiar agropecuaria en una reconocida universidad. Sus estudios lo pago gracias a su trabajo, pues desde que tenía 16 años comenzó a sembrar toda variedad de hortalizas de raíz, como beterraga, zanahoria, coliflor, alcachofa y brócoli, es especialista en ello. Sus cosechas los comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad. Pero la actividad que más le gusta es la crianza de cuyes, cuenta con 500 ejemplares, su secreto es el manejo de posas, las que separa de acuerdo a la edad y parentesco, cuenta que cada 3 meses aumenta el número de animales. La alimentación de sus cuyes se basa en alfalfa que el mismo siembra, por ello tienen un alto valor nutritivo. Ya lo conocen y constantemente sus clientes le solicitan para vender o comer. Su plan a corto plazo es comprar un cuy de raza macho con 10 hembras para comenzar a criar animales de mayor calidad.Jesús, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de alfalfa ya que de esto alimenta a sus animales, pues comenzará la época de sequía y desea aprovechar.
texts.en:
Jesús, 40 years old, is a working man. He lives with Bertha, his wife of 20 years. Together they have three young children whom they care for in the house he inherited from his parents 20 years ago. When he was a boy, he learned to farm and raise animals. From there, he decided to study agriculture and livestock at a recognized university. His studies were paid for thanks to his work because when he was 16 he started planting all types of crops, such as rice, beets, carrots, cauliflower, artichokes, and broccoli; he specializes in this. He sells the harvest at the city market.

But the work he loves most is raising guinea pigs. He has 500 of them. His secret is maintaining their positions; he separates them according to their age and relationships. Every three months, the number of animals grows. The guinea pig feed is mostly alfalfa, which Jesus plants; this is because alfalfa has high nutritional value. People know him, and his customers are constantly ordering guinea pigs to sell or eat. His short-term plan is to purchase a male guinea pig and 10 females to begin raising higher quality animals. Jesus will invest the money in the purchase of organic compost to fertilize his alfalfa crops since this is what he feeds his animals. The drought season will start, and he wants to take advantage of it.

loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Bavi's Group

texts.en: Bavi is a 46-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Bavi has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him continue his business. Bavi is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Batanai A Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 46-year-old Margaret from Masvingo. She is married and has four children, two of whom are attending school. She also cares for one other dependent. Margaret runs an agricultural business, rearing and selling chickens. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of a limited market for chickens in the communal areas where she lives. Margaret has applied for a loan of US$300 to buy feed for her chicks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her disposable income, and thus to improve family welfare. In the future, Margaret plans to keep many chickens and expand her market area into the town.

loans.use: to buy feed for her business of raising chickens.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a married mother with five school-going children. They live at their own house, which has no electricity or piped water. She operates a food kiosk, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the form of competition from other food kiosk operators. With a loan of KES 30,000, she wants to buy cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for sale in her food kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, fish and vegetables to sell in her community.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de trois membres qui habitent la même localité,elles ont pour activité le petit commerce.

Celle qui léve son bras sur la photo,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée,âgée de 54 ans mére de 05 enfants.

Son activité est la production de jus de bissap et de pain de singe,en plus elle achéte et revend les tissus de qualité wax et Khartoum.

Elle compte acheter un sac de sucre,une bassine de bissap à 2500f ,un sac de pain de singe pour une valeur de 10000f,dix rames de tissus wax et 05 rames de tissu Khartoum.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three members who live in the same town. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

This borrower is the one in the photo with her arm raised. She is the group's official. She is married, 54 years old, and a mother of five children. 

Her business involves producing drinks made from hibiscus flowers or from 'monkey bread' (the fruit of the baobab tree). She also buys and sells quality Wax and Khartoum fabrics.

She intends to purchase a bag of sugar, a tub of dried hibiscus flowers at 2,500 francs, a sack of 'monkey bread' at 10,000 francs, 10 reams of Wax cloth, and 5 reams of Khartoum cloth.

Her goal is to increase her savings and cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, hibiscus flowers, 'monkey bread', and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Vilma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Vilma, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo por lo que requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar guacales, sartenes, ollas de loza, entre otros para ofrecerles  variedad a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio e incrementar las ganancias; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Vilma needs a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her business. This will permit her to purchase purchase wooden crates, frying pans, serving dishes, and other items to offer variety to her customers.

The earlier loan helped her strengthen her business and increase her revenues. The economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: purchase wooden crates, frying pans, serving dishes, etc.

loans.name: Aydın

texts.en: Aydın is 47 years old, married, and the father of five children. His wife is retired. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Aydin is Fuzuli refugee. He has been raising cattle for the past 20 years. He says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals requires continuous effort, but his wife helps him to raise the cattle, fatten them, and sell in the market. He usually buys the cattle and sells them in the central bazaar after raising and fattening them. His monthly income is 300 AZN. This is the only source of income for the family. He plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan, due the large use of meat in daily meals. Aydin is applying for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy more calves. This is going to be his fifth loan from Aqroinvest. He believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to buy more calves to raise, fatten and sell.

loans.name: Ngan's Group

texts.en:
Ngan is 35 years old. She has three children. Her daughters are in 10th grade and 8th grade. Her son is in 2nd grade. She and her husband are carpenters. Her husband earns about 8,000,000 VND per month. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 16 years. Besides that, she also has a farm and breeds chickens. Her family’s total income is about 12,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is lacking capital to buy wood for making beds and cabinets. Her dream is to expand her carpentry workshop to make beds and cabinets to export. This loan is one step that helps her reach toward her dream. She wants to gain earnings, save profit to expand her carpentry workshop, raise children up well, and build a home. She is a hardworking woman and a passionate businessperson.

She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2011. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND for carpentry. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. Other members who are part of Ngan’s group include the following: 
Kha is 51 years old. She has two children. She sells vegetables. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to develop her work. 
Thinh is 20 years old. She has two children. She sells fruits. She wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to do carpentry.
Thuy is 18 years old. She has a child. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to do carpentry.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop

loans.name: Vazirjon

texts.ru: Человек с огромным желанием стать успешным в жизни, первый цикл кредитуется в ИМОНе. Его зовут Вазирджон.  Ему 27  лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более  3 лет он занимается скотоводством. В основном он откармливает мелко-рогатого скота. Он продает свой скот на местном рынке. Благодаря упорному труду и серьёзному отношению своему бизнесу, он имеет своих постоянных клиентов на местном рынке. Он планирует развевать бизнес и увеличить доход. С такой целью он обратился за займом. Он запрашивает займ для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A person with a huge desire to become successful in life is obtaining his first loan from IMON.  His name is Vazirjon.  He is 27 years old, married and raising two children.  The climate at his place of residence is quite favorable for growing agricultural crops and also for animal husbandry.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over three years.  He primarily fattens up small livestock.  He sells his livestock at a local market.  Thanks to his persistent work and serious attitude about his business, Vazirjon has regular clients at the local market.  He plans to develop his business and increase the income.  He requested a loan with this goal in mind.  Vazirjon is requesting this loan to buy livestock in order to develop his business.  He plans to provide his children with current technology with the resulting income.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to develop his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó su trabajo hace años atrás con la venta de útiles escolares. Poco a poco mejorando sus ingresos debido a las ventas comenzó a mejorar su mercadería. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06:30am hasta las 21:00pm todos los días vendiendo papelería y útiles escolares en un pequeño negocio que tiene. Vende los cuadernos a $ 1.50 c/u. La dificultad que tiene es que es Pvvs (persona viviendo con vih sida). 

El tiene muchas aspiraciones de continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar el préstamo útiles escolares por la epoca de escolaridad que esta de temporada.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  He started his business of selling school supplies years ago.  Little by little his income was improving.  Due to the sales, he started to improve his merchandise.

He currently works from 6:30 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. every day.  He sells stationery items and school supplies in a small business that he has.  He sells notebooks for $1.50 each.  The difficulty that he has is that he is PVVS (person living with HIV/AIDS).

He has a lot of aspirations to continue with his business.  Therefore, he wants to use the loan to buy school supplies for the current school season.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: José Angel

texts.es:
José tiene  41 años de edad, es casado y tienen cinco hijos. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, es una tradición familiar; su padre fue quien le enseño desde muy pequeño y hoy en día él le enseña a sus hijos a cultivar maíz y frijol. Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a 13 kilómetros de su casa; para llegar hasta allí debe pagar un vehiculo para que le traslade los insumos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, mano de obra, pago para rastrear la tierra y que este lista para cultivar maíz, frijol y maicillo. Através del crédito es la única forma que tiene José para cultivar y obtener parte del alimento de sus hijos. En este momento él esta comprando estos granos básicos; pero con el crédito espera cultivarlos él mismo. Su deseo, es continuar cosechando; ya que quiere construir una casa grande de adobe, debido a que en la que vive es de lámina y muy incomoda, además que el calor y el frío es muy agobiante y afecta la salud de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old, married and has five children. For 30 years he has been a farmer. It is a family tradition; his father was the one who taught him when he was very young, and now he teaches his children to cultivate corn and beans. He gets his farming supplies in a city that is 13 km from his house. To get there, he has to pay a taxi to transport the supplies.

The loan he is requesting from Kiva partner Fundacion Campo is to purchase seeds, compost, herbicide, pesticide, hire helping hands, pay to till the land and get it ready to farm corn, beans, and wheat. This loan is the only means Jose has to farm and get some of the sustenance for his children. At this moment, he is purchasing basic grains, but with the loan, he hopes to grow them himself. His desire is to continue harvesting because he wants to build a big adobe house because the one his family lives in now is made of sheet rock and is very uncomfortable. Beside, the heat and cold is oppressive and affects his children's health.

loans.use: purchase seeds, compost, herbicide, pesticide, hire helping hands, pay to till the land and get it ready to farm corn, beans, and wheat.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó su negocio hace 2 años atrás cuando su tia le ayudo financieramente para comprar algunas cosas para tener su propio restaurante. Poco a poco y con la ayuda de su hermano ya que el tiene una lavadora de carros, comenzó a tener ingresos. 

En la actualidad tiene un restaurante donde vende almuerzos. Su hermano lo ayuda ya que los clientes de la lavadora de carros pasan a almorzar a su restaurantes. El trabaja desde las 05:00am hasta las 14:30pm. Su dificultad en ocasiones es que es pvvs (persona viviendo con vih sida) pero no le dificulta al 100% porque tiene a una persona que le cocina en los días que el no puede atender su negocio. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su restaurante por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo una cocina industrial para poder cocinar a un volumen mas alto.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  He started his business two years ago when his aunt helped him financially in order to buy some things to have his own restaurant.  Little by little, with the help of his brother because he has a car wash, he started to get income.

He currently has a restaurant where he sells lunches.  His brother helps him because the car wash customers stop by to have lunch at his restaurant.  He works from 5:00 a.m until 2:30 p.m.  At times his difficulty is that he is PVVS (person living with HIV/AIDS).  However, this does not hinder 100% performance because he has a person who cooks on the days when he is not able to tend to his business.

He has a lot of aspirations for his restaurant.  Therefore, he wants to use the loan to buy an industrial stove in order to be able to cook a greater volume.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove.

loans.name: Regino

texts.es:
Regino es una persona de 36 años de edad, tiene una hermosa familia de 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 son hombres y 2 mujeres, de todos ellos cuatro están estudiando; estudian por las mañanas y ayudan a su papa por las tardes. Don Regino y sus hijos viven actualmente en Caserío Tierra  Linda, Cantón Sacsiguan, Sololá.
El es de oficio agricultor, sin embargo se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su tienda que tiene establecida en su vivienda. Con los ingresos que obtiene de esta tienda le da sostenimiento a su familia y educación de sus hijos.Tiene 2 años de tener su tienda y tiene aceptable demanda de los vecinos de su comunidad
El quiere ampliar su tienda y por ello está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para compra de abarrotes.
El sueño más grande de don Regino es contar un local en el centro de Sololá para poder vender más e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Regino, 36, has a beautiful family of seven children, five males and two females, four of whom are attending school.  They study in the morning and help their father in the afternoon.  Regino and his children currently live in the Tierra Linda community of Sacsiguan Canton in Sololá.

He's a farmer by trade, although he works selling groceries in the store he set up in his house.  With his income from this store he supports his family and his children's education.  He has had the store for two years and has reasonable demand from his neighbors in the community.

He wants to expand his store, so he's requesting a loan for 3,500 quetzales [GTQ] to buy groceries.

Regino's biggest dream is to have a place in the center of Sololá to be able to sell more and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother with six children in school. They live in their own house, which has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated a food selling business, selling cashew nuts to her neighbors and to passersby. She faces a major challenge in her business from competition from other cashew nut sellers. With KES 40,000, she wants to purchase more cashew nuts for resale. 

She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia offers manicures, pedicures, hair cutting, hair re-bonding, hair color and hair dye in her small beauty parlor. She has already been operating the business for 26 years. According to her the business is a great source of income. With it she is able to provide the daily needs of her family. Now she wishes to expand and improve her small parlor but insufficiency of funds hinders her dream. This led Delia to request a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy materials to expand her parlor and to purchase new scissors, nail polish and hair color. She just hopes that her requested loan will be provided in order to make her dreams into reality.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand her beauty parlor and also to purchase new scissors, nail polish and hair color

loans.name: Sugra

texts.en:
Sugra is 44 years old and married, but she has no kids. Sugra is an IDP (internally displaced person), and lives with her husband in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Fizuli refugee. 

She has dedicated 10 years of her life to agriculture. She plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants and other vegetables and fruits. Her income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 AZN. She has more plans for the future, such as to obtain more lands for cultivation.  She is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase fruits a lot.

She has applied for a loan on 1900 AZN to buy new fertilizers and seeds.  These will help her to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to earn more revenue in the coming summer.  This will help her to support her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 27-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She works selling Brazilian gold, accessories and perfumes to help her husband in covering their family's expenses. Her husband is an electrician who works upon request with no fixed daily income. 

She is well known in her region and highly supported by her customers. 

Abir applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business capital to purchase a newly released jewelry collection. The sales will improve and develop her business a lot, which will reflect positively on both her social and financial situation.

Her work at home helps her a lot in taking good care of her children and family as a whole, and at the same time, she is improving their standard of living. 

Abir has future plans to open her special shop selling jewelry and perfume as soon as her children are grown up enough, and as soon as she saves the requested amount for this step forward.

loans.use: to increase her business capital to purchase a newly released jewelry collection

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Nieves is a 53 year old mother of two grown-up children from the village of Massippi. Nieves is engaged in selling different products in her community like soap, shampoo and toothpaste. Nieves wants to have additional income so she is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 17,000 to buy canned goods, spices, noodles and snack foods for her store. She hopes that she can saved money for her two kids for their future needs.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, noodles and snack foods for her store

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana  is 47 years old and the mother of 7 children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Jabrayili refugee. Yegana  is a farmer. She has been doing this work for 10 years, and she has been doing it by herself since she started. In addition, she really enjoys her work because she feels free and independent. At the same time, it’s going very well for her, and this helps her to feel calmer. 

Her plans are to expand her cropland, care for it and integrate more technology so she can obtain an excellent harvest. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to the university so they can get training and be able to take over the family business when they inherit the land.

Yegana has already taken a loan from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history she has applied for a second loan of 1800 AZN to buy mineral fertilizers in order to treat her soil and get a good harvest. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to treat her soil and get a good harvest

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past two and half years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support and she appreciates the help.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en:
Vafa is 35 years old and the mother of 2 sons. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She has dedicated 12 years of her life to agriculture. Vafa usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her  monthly income is 140 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in her family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Vafa also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.
 
She has already taken 4 loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history she has applied for this fifth loan of 2000 AZN in order to purchase three cattle and one milking cow. With this money she wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: 8125246 Group

texts.en:
The Om-Abdarzaq group consists of four women from Hodeida, Yemen. They have asked for a loan in the total amount of 80,000 YER from AMB.
Maha, 29 years old, is a married woman with three children. She is illiterate and lives with her children in a small house. She works very hard to provide her family with everything they need, but what she earns is really not enough. For one year she has been a door-to-door clothes and cosmetics seller. 
To date she has earned good profits, and she now wants to expand her business which would enable her to earn more money. As a result, she applied for a loan in the amount of 20,000 YER to buy clothes and cosmetic materials for her business. She is very ambitious and loves her family very much. Going forward, she wants to educate her children and to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetic materials for her business.

loans.name: Serakazi Group

texts.en:
Hawa is in her late 30's and is married with two children who go to school. She has been a tailor for 10 years now. She works from 8:00 am to 11:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hawa's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more material and sewing equipment. She is doing very well because she can now take care of her family and can take her children to a good school for better education. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more material for making clothes and suits. She used to buy the material in meters but now she can buy in rolls. She dreams of finishing building her house.

Hawa will share this loan with her loan group "SERAKAZI" which has ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more material for making clothes and suits.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is married and has been blessed with five school going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes in the upbringing of their children. They stay in their own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. In addition she sells cashew-nuts to supplement her income. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma operates a food stall business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 27 years old and single. She lives in a rural community with her beloved parents and younger brother and sister. Due to financial difficulty, she did not pursue her studies in college. She works and helps her parents in earning income to satisfy their necessities and support the schooling of her younger brother and sister. She engages herself in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She aims to improve this business and make it more profitable. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan amounting to  PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for the maintenance of her pigs. She believes that she can improve her business through her requested loan. She just hopes that it will be granted.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for the maintenance of her pigs

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima operates a grocery vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. she dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the near future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. she decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the previous loan that helped her to boost her stock.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Cahangir

texts.en:
Cahangir is 36 years old, married, and the father of four children. He is an 'internally displaced person' (IDP), and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Cahangir is a Fuzulu refugee. 

He raises cattle, fattens them, and sells them for a profit; he has been in this business for 12 years. Cahangir is very kind and caring, and is also very energetic in his work. Cahangir chose not to study since high school, but to continue the family tradition and to do this business. This is a very profitable business, and he is doing it together with his wife.

Cahangir sells meat at the central bazaar for profit. In Azerbaijan, there is a high demand for meat because it is used in a lot of meals, such as kufta (soup), kababs, dolma, etc. His income from this business is 195 AZN per month. 

In order to fully support the family, Cahangir is looking forward to expanding the business and making it very successful. With a good loan history, he has applied for his sixth loan of 2000 AZN. 

He hopes to buy small calves with the loan. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy small calves.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn manages a hog raising business in her community as a way of helping her husband gain income for their family.  She is 39 years old, and has three school-age children. She and her husband aim to send their children to school, and for them to finish a college degree and have good paying jobs someday.  

To fulfill this, she  decided get a loan of P10,000 to buy additional piglets, feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. 

She believes that her loan will enable her to improve the business and hopes that someday she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha operates an open air food business, selling from home to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge insufficient capital to boost her business. She dreams of expanding to a café business. 

With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice, and sugar. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business; she appreciates the previous support granted very much.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice, and sugar for her open air stall.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is single and has no children. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. 

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Martins

texts.pt:
Martins é casado, pai de 2 filhos e vive na casa própria com a família. Trabalha como montador de pneus numa pequena empresa durante 8 horas diárias.
Com o dinheiro deste empréstimo vai comprar cimento, varões, chapas e pedra para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa. Actualmente a sua casa tem apenas 2 divisões que ainda precisam de ser rebocadas. Além disso, o Sr Martins pretende também construir mais divisões na mesma casa (sala, cozinha, etc.).
No futuro pretende terminar a sua construção e comprar mobiliário.
texts.en:
Martins is married and has two children. He lives with his family in a house that he owns. He works as a wheel assembler for a small company for 8 hours a day.
With the money from this loan he'll purchase cement, rods, metal sheets and rocks in order to continue building his house. His house currently has only two rooms which still need to be plastered. Besides, Martins also intends to build more rooms in that same house (a living room, a kitchen, etc.).
In the future he plans to finish the construction work and purchase furniture.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, metal sheets and rocks in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Rita Ines

texts.pt:
Rita é solteira, tem nível médio de escolaridade, vive na casa própria e tem 3 filhos, um dos quais estuda na nona (9ª) classe. Ela trabalha como técnica administrativa numa escola primária durante 8 horas diárias. 
Com o recente empréstimo pretende comprar areia, cimento e blocos para construção de cozinha, despensa e para terminar a cobertura da varanda da sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir um muro de vedação e comprar mobília. Segundo ela, vai continuar a fazer empréstimos na Hluvuku-Adsema para fazer os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Rita is single and has completed high school. She lives in a house that she owns and she has three children, one of whom attends 9th grade. Rita works as an administrative assistant in an elementary school for 8 hours a day.
With this recent loan she intends to purchase sand, cement and bricks in order to build a kitchen, a pantry and finish the roofing on the porch of her house.
In the future she plans to build a surrounding wall and buy furniture. According to her, she'll continue to apply for loans with Hluvuku-Adsema so she can achieve her projects.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks in order to build a kitchen, a pantry and finish the roofing on the porch of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Laximidio

texts.pt:
Laximidio é casado e vive em casa da mãe com a sua esposa e o seu filho que ainda não está em idade escolar. É professor de uma escola primária e trabalha 8 horas diárias. Além da sua profissão, é também estudante universitário à distância.
Laximidio e a sua esposa têm um negócio de venda de roupas usadas, gerido pela sua esposa. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada para revender no mercado de Boane.
No futuro pretende terminar a licenciatura, construir a sua própria casa, casar oficialmente, ampliar o negócio e liquidar o empréstimo para solicitar mais.
texts.en:
Laximidio is married and lives in his mother's house with his wife and his son, who hasn't reached school age yet. He's an elementary school teacher and works 8 hours a day. Aside from his job, he's also a college student through distance education.
Laximidio and his wife own a business selling used clothing, which is run by his wife. With this loan he intends to purchase bundles of used clothing for re-selling at the market in Boane.
In the future he intends to finish his undergraduate studies, build a house of his own, make his marriage official, expand his business and repay the loan so he can apply for more.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing for re-selling.

loans.name: Serigne Sam

texts.fr:
Serigne Sam est transporteur de profession, il a une expérience de plus de 2 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant et n’a pratiquement pas de charges.
Serigne Sam vient solliciter un crédit de 200000F CFA pour acheter un tracteur. C’est un novice dans le crédit  et voudrait améliorer son transport et maximiser son profit. Il travaille de 10h à 18h.
Grâce au crédit, il pourra désormais épargner dans le but d’acquérir un autre véhicule.
texts.en:
Serigne Sam is a professional transporter.  He has more than two years of experience in his field of work.  He is single with no children, and he barely has any expenses.  He is requesting a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to buy a tractor.

Serigne Sam is a novice at taking loans.  His goal is to improve his transportation service and to maximize his profit.  He works from 10AM until 6PM.

Thanks to this loan, he will now be able to save some money in order to purchase another vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a tractor.

loans.name: Enih Caroline

texts.en:
This borrower is married with five children and lives in a four-room apartment in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced many difficulties such as her children being sick, death of family members and inadequate finances to run her business successfully and provide three square meals for her family.

With this loan, she will purchase and sell kernel and palm oil in bulk.  She is positive about the business succeeding because she has been in the business for years and has regular customers.  The demand for palm oil is high with low supply in her community.  With her business, the community will have a regular supply of kernel and palm oil and the goods will be sold at moderate prices as she will buy in bulk.  

With the proceeds from this loan, she will expand her business by buying more jugs of palm oil and kernel as well.  She will also pay for her children's education and three meals as well as save some funds to undertake larger investments.  

She prefers GHAPE loans because of convenient repayment intervals, low interest rates and the training offered to members before disbursement of a loan.

loans.use: To buy kernel and palm oil.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en: Kyalo is a 36-year-old man who is married and has two children.  He describes himself as visionary and ambitious.  He sells second-hand shoes to earn a living and his business is located on the side of the road.  He will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more shoes to sell.  His business challenge is that he is financially constrained.  He will use the profits from the business to pay his children's school fees and also invest in his business.  In the future he hopes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sulaiman B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are the teachers of a primary school located in Waterloo, a town in Western Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT (a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone) to apply for a loan of SLL 14,600,000 in order to meet their most immediate and pressing financial challenges. Additionally at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Sulaiman is the featured leader of this group of teachers. A native of Joe Town, the 46-year-old is married to a trader.  The couple have 7 children, 6 of whom are attending primary and secondary school. Sulaiman is going to use his share of this loan to buy building materials such as cement, sticks, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, sticks, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Mui's Group

texts.en:
Mui is 34 years old. She has three children who are in primary and secondary school; her little son is in kindergarten.  Her husband is a builder, and he earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. 

Mui cooks food to sell. Her income is about 3,500,000 VND. She has done this job for seven years. Her family’s total income is 7,500,000 VND per month. 

Mui has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND to breed chickens and dogs, and to grow fruit trees. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy food for chickens and dogs, and to buy ingredients to cook food. She can gain earnings and save the profit so the children grow up well, and to buy household equipment.

Other members who are part in Mui’s group include Xuyen, who is 55 years old, with two children. She sells fish in the market, and she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to develop her work.
 
Xuyen is 53 years old, with two children. She sells groceries, and wants to borrow 7,630,000VND to develop her work.
 
Ly is 48 years old, with two children. She breeds chickens, and wants to borrow 10,246,000 VND to buy food for the chickens.

Lanh is 45 years old, and she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and dogs, and to buy ingredients to cook food.

loans.name: Ruth  Albina

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth tiene 27 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 3 y 8 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de jugos de frutas, gelatinas, crema de leche, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Alto Pampahasi, La Sra. Ruth es una persona muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara muebles y si le sobre un saldo  electrodomésticos para su casita, el deseo de La Sra. Ruth es crecer en su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos también mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de sus hijos ya que por ellos se esfuerza para que puedan estudiar y ser personas de bien.
texts.en: Ruth is 27 years old. She has two children, ages three and eight years. She sells fruit juice, jello, and cream at her sales stand in the Alto Pampahasi zone. Ruth is a very hardworking person. With the loan money, she will buy furniture, and if there is some leftover, electric appliances for her little home. Ruth wants to grow her business and improve her revenue stream, as well as improve her quality of life for herself and her children because it is for them that that she works so hard so that they can go to school and be well-off people.

loans.use: purchase furniture for her home

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is made up of two members, both of whom are women. 

Mary is the general leader and the leader here too. She is 53 years old and has three adult children who are on their own. She has worked, for eight years now, by supplying fish to customers around Teshie and Nungua.

This is her fifth loan with ID-Ghana and she is requesting a loan of 1500 GHS to buy three cartons of fish to supply to her customers. Her customers come home for their goods. Payments are made instantly, which make it more secure and prudent.  

Mary faces challenges in her business; it is competitive as there are other fish sellers around, but her customer-care strategy makes her top them all. She desires for her business to continue increasing its earnings and continue growing. She feels happy and grateful for Kiva's support.

Mary, together with Beatrice, needs a total amount of 1900 GHS to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy three cartons of fish to supply to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una señorita soltera de 28 años quien vive con sus padres, quienes viven en la Calle Bugdof 2 Aldea San Jorge La Laguna, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la compraventa de artesanías como joyería de plata, bolsas artesanales y figuras de mármol, lo viene realizando desde hace 12 años. Eligio está actividad porque sus padres le enseñaron esta labor a su corta edad, es por ello que de esta manera obtiene ingresos y ganancias que le permiten aportar al sustento familiar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 que utilizara para la ampliación de su negocio para obtener diversidad de productos en joyería de plata, bolsas artesanales y figuras de mármol. 
Su sueño es construir su casa e independizarse para ser una mujer emprendedora.
texts.en:
Ana is a single woman, 28 years old, who lives with her parents, who live on Calle Bugdof 2 Aldea San Jorge La Laguna, Sololá.

She buys and sells artisan products such as silver jewelry, artisan purses, and marble figurines. She started doing this 12 years ago.

She chose this activity because her parents taught her to work at a young age, and because of this she generates revenue and earnings that allow her to support her family.

She is requesting a loan of Q. 10,000.00 that she will use to grow her business to have diversity of silver jewelry, artisan purses, and marble figurines.

Her dream is to build a home and become independent to be an entrepreneurial woman.

loans.use: grow her artisan business

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel es una persona de 40 años de edad, casado, tiene una bella familia integrada por 10 hijos, de los cuales 6 son hombres y 4 mujeres, de todos ellos 8 son menores de edad y están estudiando. Don Victor Manuel su esposa  y sus hijos viven actualmente en Barrio Chosij, municipio de San Antonio Palopó, departamento de Sololá.
El es de oficio comerciante, y actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de verduras, compra la verdura en la comunidad y luego la vende en la capital de Guatemala. Esta actividad la realiza por dos situaciones: uno porque no tiene terreno donde cultivar y por otro lado la compraventa le genera buenas ganancias con las que sostiene a su familia. El es un hombre experimentado en esta actividad porque lleva 18 años realizándola.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para comprar más cebolla porque su demanda ha incrementado.
El sueño más grande de don Victor Manuel es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando hasta graduarse.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel, 40, is married and has a beautiful family made up of ten children, six males and four females.  Eight of them are minors and attend school.  Víctor Manuel, his wife, and their children currently live in Barrio Chosij, in the town of San Antonio Palopó in Sololá Department.

He's a merchant by trade and currently works buying and selling vegetables.  He buys vegetables in his community then sells them in the capital of Guatemala.  He does this work for two reasons: because he doesn't have a plot of land to farm and because buying and selling earns him good profits with which he supports his family.  He's experienced in this work because he has been doing it for 18 years.

He's requesting a loan for 4,000 quetzales [GTQ] to buy more onions because demand has increased.

Víctor Manuel's biggest dream is to improve his family's living conditions and for his children to be able to continue studying until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy onions

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 55  años de edad el esta casado y vive en Sololá. Tiene 7 hijos de ellos 5 hombres que trabajan con el y 2 mujeres que realizan oficios domésticos.
Es un hombre amable y sobre todo trabajador, el se dedica a fabricar prendas de vestir típicos que son  utilizados por  las mujeres  indígenas de su región.
Junto a sus hijos se apoyan para realizar esta actividad usando como principal herramienta llamado  (telar) donde coloca el hilo para luego realizar estas prendas. El inicio este trabajo hace 24 años, se dio cuenta que eran pocos los fabricantes de este tipo de  prendas y que mantienen precios buenos en el mercado, es así como  empezó a  obtener buenas ganancias y a mejorar la economía de su familia.
El está solicitando un préstamo de  Q 6,500.00 para la compra de hilo tipo lana para fabricar mayor cantidad de prendas y tener mejores ganancias.
Su sueño es tener un terreno ya que quiere construirles una vivienda a sus hijos como también darles el apoyo necesario en los estudios académicos.
texts.en:
Luis, 55, is married and lives in Sololá.  He has seven children, five men who work with him and two women who do domestic chores.  He's a friendly and hardworking man.

He earns a living making traditional garments worn by indigenous women in his region.  He and his children help each other to do this job, using for their main tool a loom where they place the thread to make these garments.  He started this job 24 years ago.  He realized that there were few people who made this type of garment, which gets a good price in the market, so he started to make good profits and improve his family finances.

He's requesting a loan for 6,500 quetzales [GTQ] to buy wool thread to make a large quantity of garments and have better profits.

His dream is to have a plot of land because he wants to build his children a home and give them the support they need in their academic studies.

loans.use: to buy wool thread to make traditional garments

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: La Sra. Marianela tiene 45 años, casada tiene cuatro hijos,  ella se dedica  a la venta de comida, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Satélite, y también  entrega sus almuerzos a distintos negocios y tiendas,   La Sra. Marianela una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La Sra. Marianela les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara material de construcción para hacer terminar de construir su casa, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal, el deseo de La Sra. Marianela es crecer en su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marianela, 45, is married and has four children.  She makes a living selling food in her stall in the Satélite area.  She also delivers her lunches to various businesses and stores.  Marianela's a very hardworking and dedicated person who little by little is becoming stable and solvent as well as popular, because she's very well known among her customers for her friendly service.

With the money from the loan she'll buy construction materials to finish building her house.

The client says she can grow more with a lot of effort.  This way she'll continue acquiring assets for her family's well-being and her own.

Marianela wants to grow in her business to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 33,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan hopes to expand her business and be able to give her children a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en: Sadek is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. In 2010, he started working independently as a blacksmith. His job is located next to his home and he has one full-time employee helping him to complete the essential tasks. Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase an iron welding motor and tools needed to carry on with his work properly. He is optimistic about his business prospects and he is certain that with the loan's help his business income will increase In the future, he hopes to make the needed savings to be able to get married and afford the costly expenses.

loans.use: to purchase an iron welding motor and necessary tools.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita. She previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita dreams to have more hogs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional hogs needed for her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
This is Merly. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merly hopes that her business will be stable and dreams her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La Sra. Miriam tiene 31 años, tiene dos hijos que tiene las edades de 9 y 5 años que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica desde hace muchos años al servicio de reciclaje de chatarras y envases en el acopio que se encuentran en su misma casa en la zona de Villa Ingavi de donde distribuye a las distintas empresas, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Miriam  va a usar este préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio chatarras y envases de plástico y vidrio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar sus ganancias y por ende su capital, la Sra. Miriam enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia ya que muchas personas al igual que ella se dedican al reciclado de materiales, ella va a utilizar los beneficios compra de mas material para su negocio, el deseo de la Sra. Miriam para su negocio es tener un acopio más grande de reciclaje y poder comprar a minoristas y vender en grandes cantidades a las empresas que se encargan del reciclado de este material.
texts.en:
Miriam is 31 years old and has two school-aged children who are 5 and 9 years old.  She has worked for many years providing recycling services for scrap and containers.  Her supply is located in her home in the Villa Ingavi area, where she distributes to different businesses.  

This loan is her first with this institution.  Miriam will use this loan to purchase merchandise for her scrap and plastic and glass container business.  She wants to increase her income and her capital.  Miriam encounters challenges with her business such as competition, since there are many people who work with recycled materials like she does.  She will use the benefits of the loan to purchase more materials for her business.

Miriam hopes that her business will have a larger area for recycling and be able to purchase at retail and sell in larger quantities to businesses that are responsible for recycling this material.

loans.use: to purchase scrap items at wholesale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma, 42, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jonald, a driver and they have children. She, with the help of her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually earn income for her everyday expenses.  

Norma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. She also has a direct selling business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Norma dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: United Brothers Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “United Brothers” group. They are a small scale business based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Mohamed. Mohamed is age 37; he was born in Kono, eastern Sierra Leone. Currently, he is residing in Waterloo, together with his wife and 4 children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary schools. Mohamed is an okada driver (motor-bike taxi driver). He has requested a loan in order to buy a new motor-bike.

loans.use: to buy a new motor-bike

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
This is Gregorio. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase more stock of fishnets and scouring pads needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another loan, this time for 15,000 PHP, to buy more stock of fishnets and scouring pads needed in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Gregorio dreams to expand his business and have his own stall. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of fishnets and scouring pads needed in his business.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar is a kind and hardworking man. He lives with his wife and two sons, Nodirjon and Bobojon, in a house which is in bad condition. His wife is a seamstress and sews very wonderful dresses. 

Akbar’s children want to live in a house which is in good condition, but his income from a taxi service is not enough for it. He must repair all the rooms of his house. He is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy building materials to repair his house. 

In this way, he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing the house.

loans.name: Manuel Mercedes

texts.es:
Manuel,  se le presenta la necesidad de invertir más en su negocio, por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo; este le permitirá comprar una cámara cannon y papel fotografico.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener más clientela; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Manuel wants to invest more in his business so he is requesting a new loan.  This will allow him to purchase a Cannon camera and photo paper.  

His last loan helped him to increase his inventory and obtain more clients.  His financial situation and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to purchase a Cannon camera and photo paper.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a divorced mother and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has no electricity and piped water. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously obtained a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy new computers and video games. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in personal, household, and business expenditures.
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy parts and to cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Alma hopes to have a better shop and good health. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy parts and to cover maintenance costs of her computer shop

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Being a responsible mother and wife, Josephine engages in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband’s income. She is 59 years old and has three grown children. They live happily in a rural community and make their living through farming and raising hogs. Josephine plans to raise more pigs to sell, but, due to inadequate capital, she wants to obtain a loan of 30,000 PHP. If the loan is granted, she intends to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise. Through hard work and strong determination, Josephine believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Camal

texts.en:
Camal is 40 years old, married and the father of 3 children.  He is a very hard working man.  He has been raising chickens for 16 years and is very active in the poultry business. He usually buys small chickens, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His wife also helps him in this business, because it’s the only income to their family. From this business his monthly income is 320 AZN.

In Azerbaijan chicken is in very high demand and people use it in everyday dishes like levengi, chicken soup, tabaca, kabab, etc. Camal sells chicken eggs too, because people use chicken eggs every day for breakfast. In one day he sells 50 eggs.

Camal has already taken 3 loans from Aqroinvest in past. With a good loan history he has applied for 4th loan of 1,800 AZN. With this money, he wants to invest it in the business and buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna is 30 years old and married with two children. Maftuna is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  

She has been running a business of selling milk for many years. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good-quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Maftuna has two children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is Maftuna's fourth loan. She is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy cows.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Mateo, de 43 años de edad vive junto a Antonia; su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 20 años.“El camino para desarrollarse en la agricultura, es muy difícil”, afirma Mateo, ya que a pesar de tener 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, aún no cuenta con terrenos agrícolas propios. Ya que su principal prioridad durante todo este tiempo, fue mantener a su familia en perfecto estado y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Razón por la cual trabaja en sus tiempos libres como estibador, cargando varios sacos de papa en diferentes camiones para trasportar a los mercados del interior del país. Además de trabajar en diferentes terrenos de cultivo ya que así aprende nuevas técnicas de cultivo para sus sembríos de papa, maíz y alverja. Los cuales vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad más cercana. Este es el quinto crédito con KIVA y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante.Mateo, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Mateo is 43 years old. He lives with his wife Antonia, to whom he has been married for 20 years. They have 4 children together, but only 3 live with them. They bought their house 20 years ago. "The path toward prospering in agriculture is very difficult,” explains Mateo. He has more than 10 years experience in agriculture but he still doesn’t have his own agricultural land. His main goal during this time has been to keep his family in good conditions and provide a good education to his children. This is why, during his free time, he works as a porter, carrying bags of potatoes to different trucks for transport to the markets in the interior of the country. He also works on several different plots of cropland, which is how he learns new cultivation techniques for his potato, corn, and pea crops. He sells them at the wholesale market in the nearest city. This is his fifth loan with Kiva and he feels very grateful for the financial support he has received so that he could continue working. Mateo will use the 3,000.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) to buy organic manure to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Cuc's Group

texts.en:
Cuc is 55 years old. She has two children who are married. Her son is an engineer. She cooks food. Her husband helps her do her job. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month.  She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total income is 3,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,938,000 VND to expand her food stall and buy seeds to grow fruit trees. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy fertilizer to plant landscape trees. The profits will help her save money to buy household equipment such as a television, a table and chairs.

Other members who are part in Cuc’s group include the following:
 
Hang is 31 years old. She has two children. She sells chickens in the market. She wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to develop her work. 
Thu is 38 years old. She has two children. She sells breakfast foods. She wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to expand her business.
Trang is 31 years old. She has two children. She sells clothes. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to expand her business.
Mai is 35 years old. She has two children. She is a tailor. She wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy cloth.
Dinh is 41 years old. She has two children. She breeds pigs. She wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to plant landscape trees

loans.name: Apolo

texts.en:
Farming has been Apolo's business involvement. He is 32 years of age, married to an overseas Filipino worker and blessed with one child. 

Currently, he grows rice crops on his two hectares of rice field. Apolo would like to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and insecticides, but his capital is not enough. With regards to this, he is seeking a loan of PHP 30,000. He knows that this loan amount would help him much, especially in providing his crop with proper care and nutrition.

Apolo is looking forward to the approval of his requested loan amount so he can earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and insecticides, needed for his rice field.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi operates a tailoring business, making both men and women suits. In addition, she also operates a café business which also earns her an income. She sells at the market to local neighbors and passersby. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth, sewing threads and needles. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support granted which has helped her boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, sewing threads and needles

loans.name: Alae

texts.en:
Alae is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 25 years old and is the father of a child. Alae works hard to provide his family's income all by himself with the profits he gains through working in his garage. Alae specializes in changing vehicle oils and filters. He established his business in 2010 and has gained good experience in this field. Now Alae has a hired employee and has gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood.

Alae is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 USD, which he will use to pay the annual rent of his garage and to increase his inventory. Alae is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits in order to take better care of his family and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his garage and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita, 40, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Cirilo, and a mother to her children. She keeps herself busy attending to her family and doing business as her way of helping her husband in meeting daily expenses.

Mercedita is in a pillow making business. She cuts scrap materials from textiles, foams and fibers, puts them in a plain pillow case and covers it with a better looking pillow case of various cartoon designs. She makes different kinds and sizes of pillows. She also sells foam. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community. She also has clients in the market that regularly order pillows from her.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 32,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more scrap materials that she will use to make pillows. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings would be a big help for the educational expenses of her children.
