Mercedita hopes that her business will continue to grow and help her to send all her children in school. She wants a good life and health for her family. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to listen to the word of God and have a better relationship not only to God but also to her family and community. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship groupis composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build socialcapital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the materials needed for making pillows

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, age 49 and a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to William and a mother to her children. She keeps herself busy tending to her family and doing business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining daily expenses.
Helen’s business involves buying and selling foam of different sizes. Her regular customers are from her neighborhood and local community. She also has clients in the market that regularly order pillows from her. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more foam to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. These earnings would be a big help for the educational expenses of her children.
Helen dreams that her business will continue to grow. She attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to listen to the Word of God and to have a better relationship not only with God but also with her family and community.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more foam to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and food for the family.
She operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable business operators.
With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 32 years old, married and the father of 3 children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and kids in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement .  For the past 8 years he has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. His income of 100 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and he is doing it together with his wife.

He is keeping a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

He has taken a loan from Aqroinvest before and has a good loan history. This is going to be his 5th loan. This time he requires 1,900 AZN in order to purchase 12 sheep to sell more meat in the summer. He is optimistic about this loan, because in the summer more people consume meat, due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
This is Pelagia. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of slippers and sandals for kids, men and women. Her earnings are a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy more inventory of slippers and sandals for kids, men and women. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pelagia dreams to expand her business and have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of slippers and sandals for kids, men and women.

loans.name: María Marisol

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. vive junto a su mamá de crianza de 80 años de edad, y un joven con capacidades especiales de 20 años de edad, que le dejo a cargo una amiga que se fue a vivir a Estados Unidos.

En su comunidad es la presidente de la asociación de desarrollo comunal (ADESCO), por medio de la cuál han gestionado algunos proyectos;  como elaboración de una casa comunal que funciona como albergue cuando existe el problema de inundaciones, preparación técnica para el cultivo de hortalizas y otras actividades de recreación para los miembros de la comunidad.

Ella Trabaja pequeñas parcelas cultivando Maíz en  áreas de hasta 7000 metros y hortalizas como pipianes en áreas de hasta 3500 metros cuadrados. En época seca realiza riegos por gravedad en sus parcelas con ayuda de motobombas. Estas actividades las realiza desde que tiene 12 años de edad, son cultivos que realizan como tradición familiar.

 Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere  en la ciudad, se estima que hace un recorrido aproximadamente de 25 kilómetros.  Para su comunidad el servicio de transporte es difícil  y los buses llegan y salen de la comunidad 2 veces. Las cosechas las comercializan con comerciantes del mercado municipal de la ciudad, personas con las que poseen la relación comercial de más de 10 años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 1,600 libras de fertilizantes, foliares e insecticidas y el resto para pagos de mano de obra en el cultivo de 3500 metros cuadrados de pipian y 10,500 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz. La actividad agrícola es la única fuente de ingresos que existe en su comunidad y es indispensable para la vida de esta familia.

Su objetivo, es tener la capacidad de producir hortalizas con equipos de riego de mejor eficiencia como el de goteo y tener la capacidad económica para producir hortalizas como el Chile verde.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old. She has a spouse and a son. She lives with her 80 year old foster mother and a 20 year old young special needs man that was left in her care by a friend who went to live in the United States.   

In her community, she is the president of the communal development association (ADESCO), through which she has managed some projects. For example, making a communal house that serves as a shelter whenever there is a flood, technical training for growing vegetables and recreation activities for community members.

She works small land parcels growing corn in areas up to 7,000 meters and vegetables such as pipianes in areas up to 3,500 square meters. This dry season, she is doing irrigation for her parcels with help from motorized pumps. She has been doing these activities since she was 12 years old and these crops are a family tradition.

She acquires her agricultural materials in the city and estimates that she travels about 25 kilometers. For her community, transportation service is difficult and the busses come and go from the community twice. She sells her harvests with merchants from the municipal market, people with whom she has had a business relationship for more than 10 years. 

The loan that she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy 1,600 pounds of fertilizer, foliar applications and insecticides. The rest is to pay for the labor costs to plant 3,500 square meters of pipian and 10,500 square meters of corn. Farming activity is the only source of income that exists in her community and it is indispensable for the life of this family.  

Her goal is to have the capacity to produce vegetables with irrigation equipment with more efficiency such as dripping as well as having the financial capacity to produce vegetables such as the green chile.

loans.use: to buy 1,600  pounds of fertilizer, foliar applications and insecticide. The rest is to pay for labor costs to plant 3,500 square meters of pipian and 10,500 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda dreams to have a grocery store someday. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their life and businesses every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy  grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Venezuela Group

texts.en:
JAMES, who is in his early 50s is married and has three children who are going to school.  He has been doing two types of businesses.  He has been running a retail shop and selling vegetable since 1998. He works from 6.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be JAMES's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the shop's inventory and planted and sold more vegetables.  He has paid back all his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, covered household expenses and has started building his house.  He will use this loan to restock the missing items in the shop and to buy equipment for improving the farm and plant more vegetables.  His dream is to one day be able to build and finish building his house.

James will share this loan with his loan group "VENEZUELA" with eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to restock the missing items in the shop and to buy equipment for improving on the farm and plant more vegetables.

loans.name: Mwinyihamisi

texts.en:
His business is selling spare parts for motorcycles. Because of it, he's been earning his own income and therefore, helping his family on a daily basis.

This loan will help him to purchase more spare parts for motorcycles such as tires, inner tubes, pistons, rims, etc. He gives thanks for the help he's getting, since that way he'll be able to keep on growing.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak has a cafe in the school of her village. She started it 10 years ago because she needed to work and take care of her 4 children, because her husband has a small salary. 

After organizing her business, the quality of her family's living conditions became better. She takes cares of the business alone. She cooks food and sells it to pupils and teachers at the school. Her working day starts at dawn when she goes to buy the ingredients and continues throughout the day. She has additional income from animal husbandry.

She is asking for a loan of 6000 TJS to buy food products for her café. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food products for her café business.

loans.name: Bintiathuman

texts.en:
Bintiathuman has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a rental house in the near future.

With the loan of 25,000 KES she wants to purchase prawns and dry fish for resale. She joined Yehu because of favorable loan policies.

loans.use: to purchase prawns and dry fish for resale

loans.name: Hijran

texts.en:
Hijran is a merchant. He has a grocery store where he sells basic foods necessities. He also has an agriculture business from which he sells milk products. 

He is married and has two school-age children under his care. His wife is a housewife and helps him with the agriculture activity. 

Today, the money he is requesting is for the purchase of industrial products for his store. And after some time, he plans to hire an assistant. 

Hijran says that he feels very good about working with VFAC and Kiva because he has seen the growth in himself as a person and in his family. He has a better quality of life thanks to Kiva, which has financed all his requested loans. He invested those loans in his house and his business.

loans.use: To buy industrial products for his store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 42, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Ramie and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Arlene dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is from Iraq. 35 years old, he is married and has 3 children. Salah is the sole provider for the family.

Salah raises cattle on his small farm. He also prepares dairy products and sells them. This business has been the source of living for this family for decades. In 1999, Salah established his business and gained an excellent reputation thanks to the fresh dairy products that he offers at the market.

Salah is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD. He will use this loan to install a shelter for his cows on the farm. Salah is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may enhance the current financial conditions of the family and provide them with better living standards.

loans.use: to install a shelter for his cows on his farm

loans.name: Zusima

texts.en:
This is Zusima. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more phones and phone accessories for her retail business. Her earnings were a big help with the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more phones and phone accessories for her retail business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zusima hopes to expand and have another branch. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more phones and phone accessories for her retail business.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is 44 years old and the mother of three children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement .She has dedicated 18 years of her life to agriculture. Her husband helps her in this business. She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 300 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in her family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Tarana also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to her neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two cattle and one milking cow. This will be her fourth loan.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and one milking cow

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is 31 years old, married and has three children. With her spouse, she manages a furniture-making business as their source of income. They also hire laborers who help them in the business. They make tables and chairs for sofas and kitchens. She wants to improve and make more furniture, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more wood to use in the furniture shop. It will help improve her sales and the income necessary to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy more wood to use in the furniture shop

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is married and lives in Likoni, Mombasa. She has a fish business. She has been buying and selling fish for over three years. She says that with great effort, her business is growing, and she is equipping it little by little. She hopes to be able to have a great place of business. That way she will be able to have better conditions for her customers.

She requested the loan to buy a freezer and a cooler. They will be extremely useful in transporting and conserving her product. She always wants to be able to give her customers fresh, good quality products.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a cooler.

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 30 years old and has a 2 children.

Karrar owns a small shop where he sells fresh fruits and vegetables. He established his business in 2011 and gained his experience through previously working at a similar shop as an employee for several years. Karrar now has 2 hired employees and is well-known in the area thanks to his fresh products.

Karrar is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his shop by installing ceramic blocks on the floor and the walls. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing ceramic blocks on the floor and the walls.

loans.name: Rahbarzhon

texts.en: Rahbarzhon is married and has three children. Rahbarzhon is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to her children. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry 12 years ago. She cares for the cattle at her house where she has good circumstances. She has three cows and eight sheep. She requested a loan of 1500 somoni to increase the number of animals she has for sale. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu is 36 years old. She has three children who are learning at secondary and primary school. Her husband is a builder to earn a living. He earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. Thu grows vegetables to earn a living. She has done this job for ten years. She earns about 4,000,000 per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month.

Thu has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND to grow vegetables. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy vegetable seeds.

Other members who are part of Thu's group include the following:

Do is 61 years old. She has two children. She grows vegetables. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in growing vegetables. 
Hang is 32 years old. She has one child. She sells food. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to invest in her business.
Tam is 57 years old. She has four children. She sells vegetables. She wants to borrow 6,322,000VND to invest in growing vegetables 
My is 45 years old. She has two children. She grows vegetables. She wants to borrow 10,246,000 VND to invest in growing vegetables.
My is 50 years old. She has two children. She grows vegetables. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to invest in growing vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is an Iraqi youth client. He is 19 years old and lives with his family of 5 members. Ali assists his parents in providing the family income.

Ali owns a small grocery store. He sells canned food, drinks, and dairy products. He has been practicing this business since 2009. Regardless of Ali’s age, his wide knowledge of the market gives him a good reputation.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his grocery store. Ali is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide himself a good career and a good source of living.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.en:
Rahbar is a hardworking person who is married and has 5 children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 13 years. She has great experience in this business. Thanks to the good condition of her animals, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers.

Rahbar is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She awaits your support. She promises to make payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has two children. They live in the town of Likoni, Mombasa in their own house. They have a grocery store in their house. The store is well stocked, well known, and frequented by their neighbors and occasional customers.

The products that she offers are all of the basic needs items like sugar, rice, tea, dairy products, and other merchandise.

The requested loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of basic needs merchandise for the grocery store that she has.

loans.use: to buy more basic needs merchandise for the grocery store.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a very hardworking person with a persistent spirit and attitude. She has much experience in her field and knows what she is doing. Her goal is to one day have a large beauty salon and to be widely known for her talent. She is grateful for this opportunity, and believes that the support will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to remodel her beauty salon.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene, tiene 50 años, está casada con Roque y ellos viven solos en su de material rústico, debido a que su única hija trabaja de manera independiente en una ciudad cercana. Pese a que los trabajos del campo son muy pesados, ella no se amilana, sino por el contrario piensa en sus metas y se esmera por hacer bien las cosas, pues lleva 20 años dedicada a la agricultura ,le gusta sembrar arveja y flor de gladiolo, por los grandes beneficios económicos que le brinda ya que son muy solicitados en su región, además le encanta criar gallinas y cuyes , sin embargo le disgusta pelear con las inclemencias del tiempo que muchas veces le arrebato parte de sus cosechas y hasta la llevaron al fracaso años atrás, por suerte ahora cuenta con un asesoramiento técnico para salvar su producción.Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Irene, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues su meta es mejorar la calidad de sus alimentos.
texts.en: Irene is 50 years old. She is married to Roque, and they live alone in their house made of rustic materials, since their only daughter works independently in a nearby city. In spite of the fact that the farm work is very hard, she does not back down, but on the contrary, she thinks of her goals and exerts herself to do things well. She has worked in agriculture for 20 years. She likes to plant peas and gladiolus flowers for the great economic benefits that they offer her, since they are very sought after in her region. In addition, she loves to raise chickens and guinea pigs. Nevertheless, she dislikes struggling with the weather, which often takes part of her harvests and even led to failure years ago. Fortunately, she now has technical advice to save her production. This is her fifth loan with Kiva, and she feel grateful for the financial support that she receives to continue forward. Irene will invest the 2500 PEN in the purchase of organic compost to feed her plantings, since her goal is to improve the quality of their nourishment.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 31-year-old married father. He has one child and his wife is currently working as a teacher to help him earn a living. Bassam owns a small barber shop in his village, and has been working as a barber for 11 years now. He contacted Al Majmoua in order to acquire a loan that he needs for the maintenance and check up of his car. He also needs the loan in order to renovate his living room for a better environment for his family. Concerning his future plans, Bassam is planning to purchase another loan in order to help his wife open a clothing store.

loans.use: To maintain his car and renovate his living room

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en: Mesalimu is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help her family. She is requesting the loan to establish a fish selling business, to purchase fish which she will use to have more fish in stock since demand is high, and she wants to be able to satisfy her customers. Mesalimu is grateful for the help she is receiving from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is single and has two children. Even though he did not receive any formal education, Joseph is a successful businessman. He sells maize in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). He has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Joseph uses his income to provide for the entire family. Joseph will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding him in improving his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Joseph plans to further diversify the type of products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more maize

loans.name: Lucas Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Lucas  trabaja en una institución del estado como guarda de seguridad.
Vive en la cuidad de Managua casado está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacerle algunas mejoras a su vivienda para darle mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Lucas works as a security guard in a state institute.

He lives in the city of Managua. He is married. He is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials to make some improvements in his home to make it more comfortable for his children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a designer and has a boutique where she sells exclusive clothing at a shopping center in Likoni, Mombasa. Rebecca has been in this line of work for more than three years. Since she has her own shop, she has many customers in the area, where she is well-known. Thanks to her business, she is able to move forward, maintain her home, and pay for any unforeseen expenses.

Rebecca is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the remodeling of her shop and purchase bales of clothes. She wants to improve the main area of her shop because providing a better look for her business will make her customers feel comfortable. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to invest in the remodeling of her shop and purchase bales of clothes.

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Kweku is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling oranges in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Kweku is married and has five children. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Kweku wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of oranges. In the long term, Kweku plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling local dishes from her chop bar in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year. Adjoa is married and has two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Adjoa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of local dishes. In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of local dishes.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a divorced woman and has two children who always help her out. Mwanasha has been a merchant for three years. She has a well-stocked dispensary with all of the basic goods in a well-populated area of Likoni. She says that she began with a small kiosk when she moved to town, and with a lot of sacrifice, she grew her business. There is a lot of competition in the area. She also says that she is very proud of her work because with her efforts, she has been able to support and educate her children. Mwanasha asks for a loan to buy rice, noodles, beef, drinks and other items so that she can continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, beef, drinks and other items to sell

loans.name: Jenat

texts.en: Jenat is single and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Jenat is a successful businesswoman. She sells soft drinks in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Jenat uses her income to provide for the entire family. Jenat will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Jenat plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is single and has 1 child. After successfully graduating junior high school, Juliana is now an established businesswoman. She sells fresh fish in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 2 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Juliana uses her income to provide for the entire family. Juliana will use the loan to purchase more fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Domingo Orlando

texts.es:
El señor domingo vive en la cuidad de Managua es una persona humilde muy trabajadora trabaja en un centro de compra de la capital desde hace 30 años en el área de limpieza.

 El señor domingo está solicitando a kiva  un crédito para hacer el cambio de techo de su vivienda que con la venida del invierno considera necesario para que no se le pase el agua  de lluvia a su casa.

A la vez manifiesta sentirse muy agradecido porque gracias a los créditos que ceprodel le ha otorgado ha  mejorado su casa para darle mejor condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Domingo lives in the city of Managua. He is a humble and very hard-working person. He has worked in the cleaning area of a shopping center in the capital for 30 years.

Señor Domingo is applying to Kiva for a loan to change the roof of his home, which he finds necessary with the coming of winter, so that the rainwater does not come into his house.

He also declares that he feels very grateful because thanks to the loans that CEPRODEL has offered him, he has improved his house to give better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 35-year-old single lady. She is employed in a flower shop and works 10 hours a day, every day of the week. Her income is barely enough to provide for her own expenses. Unfortunately, Nisrine contacted Al Majmoua because her mother is sick at the hospital, and needs assistance and care that she cannot afford. Thus, she needs to acquire a loan that would help her pay the hospitalization costs. 

She hopes that one day she can afford to open her own shop to make her dream come true.

loans.use: To pay for her mother's hospitalization costs.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Even though Esi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells groundnuts and maize in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began just a few months ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. 

Esi has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more groundnuts and maize to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts and maize to sell.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat, age 41, is a married lady and a mother of five children. She has been running a business of hand embroidery for the past three years. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her locality. To meet with the increasing demand for her embroidery designs, she is including other women in her business to complete the orders of her customers on time. But due to lack of capital, she is not able to fulfill the demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) through Kashf Foundation. In this way, she will be able to buy more frames, needles, unique pearls and threads in different colors, which will help in generating more income. She is in her second loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles, unique pearls and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is married to a taxi driver. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. Gifty is currently a seamstress in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). With over two years of experience in this trade, Gifty sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus, her loan will be used to buy more cloth and other sewing materials, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. 

Gifty wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Badr

texts.en: Badr is a 51-year-old married mother of three children. She is the owner of her supermarket in her village, while her husband works in a restaurant. Their combined revenue is barely enough to provide for the entire family. She contacted Al Majmoua because it was her last hope to acquire a loan. In fact, she needs a loan to purchase aluminum windows for her house. She also wishes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum windows for her house.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Even though Efua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She sells fried fish in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 20 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their eight children. 

Efua has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 40-year-old married woman doing a business of milk sales for the past 10 years. She has one cow in milk and two goats. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. 

She has four children. She is very motivated to provide them a healthy life with good education, food and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. Now, she applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy one more cow and some cans for milk storage. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and some cans for milk storage.

loans.name: Muglani

texts.en:
Muglani is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. Ten years ago, she started her own business of agriculture with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who assists her by watering the soil for getting good quality production. They crop different kinds of vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Muglani applied a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees). She is in her second loan cycle. This loan would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Kofi is an entrepreneur. He specializes as a blacksmith in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Kofi is married and has three children. His wife works as a farmer. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Kofi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of tools and other materials, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kofi plans to further diversify the type of products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of tools and other materials.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 46-year-old married father of two children. He works as a public taxi driver and has his own vehicle for the job. He works every day from sunrise, when people rush to get to their work, till night. He has been working in this field for 23 years now. His wife is unemployed, which renders him the only financial provider of the family. One of his children is enrolled in a private school, while the other is enrolled in a public school, which means that he has schooling tuition and fees on top of the other family expenses. Thus, maximizing his revenue is a priority. 

He contacted Al Majmoua in order to acquire a loan for the maintenance of his car, and to renovate his house (with paint, electronics, etc.). A loan would alleviate the burden of the other expenses mentioned above. As for the future, Ahmad wishes to buy a new car for his work as a taxi driver in order to increase the number of customers and tourists.

loans.use: To pay for necessary maintenance for his car and renovate his house.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata est une des plus braves femmes de ce banc villageois, très dynamique et déterminée à faire progresser son activité, de plus elle jouit d’une expérience avérée dans le commerce de détail partant des marchés hebdomadaires.

Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont une fille. Son activité consiste à l’achat de produits alimentaires au marché hebdomadaire international de la région pour la revente dans son village et les villages aux alentours.

Pour ce prêt, elle compte acheter en quantité : 10 sacs de riz à 13 000 F Cfa, 05 sacs d’ognon de production locale à 10 000 F Cfa le sac, 02 sacs de patates douces 10 000 F Cfa, 01 bidon d’huile de palm à 20 000 F Cfa, 03 cartons de savon à 7 000 F Cfa le carton. Elle espère obtenir en moyenne 15000 F Cfa de bénéfice net par semaine.

Cette marge elle l’utilisera pour le renforcement de son épargne d’une part et d’autre part pour faire face aux frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata is one of the most courageous women of this "Banc Villageois" loan association; very dynamic and determined to advance her business. Moreover, she has a proven track record as a retail merchant in the weekly markets.

She is a married mother of three children, including a daughter. Her activity consists in buying food products at the regional weekly international market for resale in her village and villages in the vicinity.

For this loan, she will buy in quantity: 10 bags of rice at 13,000 FCFA per bag, 5 bags of locally produced onions at 10,000 FCFA per bag, 2 bags of sweet potatoes at 10,000 FCFA per bag, 1 can of palm oil for 20,000 FCFA, 3 boxes of soap at 7000 FCFA per box.

She hopes to average net weekly profits of 15,000 FCFA.

She will use her profits both to strengthen her savings and to meet her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: buy large quantities of food products (rice, onions, sweet potatoes, palm oil, soap)

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer dedicada a la enseñanza principalmente de los niños, ya que su profesión es  maestra de educación primaria la cual tiene 16 años de trabajar como Docente, es casada con 3 personas a su cargo a los cuales les ayuda para su desarrollo, actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, por eso visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de Zinc, perlines, puertas, golosos y mano de obra.  Para la mejora de su vivienda, la que le brindara mejores condiciones  de su vida en su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Ana primarily works in children's education, being an elementary school teacher for 16 years. She is married with 3 dependents, whom she helps in their development. Right now she needs to make improvements to her house, which is why she visited Ceprodel to be a beneficiary of a loan. She will use the loan to buy tin roofing, tiles, doors, screws and labor. Improving her home will improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy tin roofing, tiles, doors, screws, labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fabric for resale at the market

loans.name: Yelba Verónica

texts.es:
La señora yelba vive en  la cuidad de Managua trabaja  como conserje en una universidad.  Donde trabaja en un horario de 8am  5 pm luego se traslada a su casa para atender a su pequeños hijos ya que es madre soltera y es mayor el esfuerzo  para salir adelante con sus hijos que están en edad escolar.

Doña yelba está solicitando un crédito a kiva para hacerles algunos cambios necesario a su vivienda como es el sistema electico esto lo hace con el fin de asegurar su vivienda.  a la vez agradece a ceprodel ya que con los créditos obtenidos ha mejorado su casa poco a poco y también  le han servido para pagarle los estudios a sus pequeños hijos ya que su mayor objetivo es preparar a sus hijos profesionalmente  en un futuro
texts.en:
Yelba lives in the city of Managua and works as a custodian in a university, where she works from 8 - 5 daily. Then she goes home to care for her young children, as she is a single mother and has to work harder to get ahead with her school age children.

Yelba is seeking a loan from Kiva in order to make some necessary modifications to her house, for instance, the electrical system. She is doing this with the goal of insuring her home. As well, she thanks Ceprodel since the loans obtained previously have improved her house little by little. They have also been used to pay for the education of her young children since her greatest objective is to prepare her children for a profession in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Danfa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 21 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé le  22 Juillet 2009. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partagent des valeurs de fraternité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Danfa (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03  enfants (1 Garçons et 2 filles âgés de 10 à 18 ans). Elle achète des sacs de patates douces et des bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palm dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour la revente par détail. 
 
Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en  plus des patates douces pour deux sacs de 10 000 F Cfa le sac, un bidon d’huile de palm pour 20 000 F Cfa et des épices pour 7 000 F Cfa.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront en d’épargner d’aider son mari dans la gestion quotidienne de la famille
texts.en:
This group consists of 21 very active women from a "Banc Villageois" loan association created July 22, 2009. They are all from the same village and share fraternity values. Their main activity is small retail business.

Mrs. Danfa (seated on the far right raising her left hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is 45 years of age, and the married mother of three children (two boys and one girl between 10 and 18 years). She buys bags of sweet potatoes and 20-liter cans of palm oil in the weekly markets to be sold retail.
 
She intends to use this loan to buy two more bags of sweet potatoes at 10,000 FCFA a bag, a can of palm oil for 20,000 FCFA and spices for 7,000 FCFA.

Profits from her activity will be used for savings and to help her husband in the daily management of the family

loans.use: buy sweet potatoes, palm oil and spices

loans.name: Satou

texts.fr:
Madame Satou, habite dans un village situé à environ 40 km de Mbour. Elle évolue dans le secteur de l’élevage : emboucher des porcs pour les revendre. Satou n’a pas de charges et travaille parce que depuis le jeune âge, elle a toujours eu un penchant pour les porcs. C’est d’ailleurs pour cette raison qu’elle pratique ce métier. Elle est active de 9h à 14h et s’occupe elle-même de l’entretien de ses bêtes.
Comme c’est son premier crédit, elle pense qu’elle pourra désormais épargner, tout en améliorant les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Elle veut augmenter le nombre de son cheptel avec l’appui de l’IMCEC, c’est là son projet pour le futur.
texts.en:
Ms. Satou lives in a village about 40 km from Mbour. She is involved in the livestock sector, namely fattening pigs for resale. 

Satou has no financial burdens and works because from an early age, she always had a penchant for pigs. It is for this reason that she performs this activity. She is active from 9 am to 2 pm and takes care of her animals herself.

As this is her first credit loan, she thinks she can now save while improving the family's nutritional conditions.

She wants to increase the size of her herd with support from IMCEC. This is her plan for the future.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mbaye, marié et père de famille, fait du commerce depuis maintenant 5 ans. Il loge à environ 40km de la ville principale de cette localité de l’ouest du Sénégal.
Son commerce consiste à vendre de l’oignon. I achète une quantité assez importante pour le stocker et le revendre un peu plus tard ; en période de hausse du prix. C’est son premier crédit, et vu la capacité d’injonction de son capital, IMCEC lui fait confiance en lui octroyant ce montant 
Il envisage d’acquérir un grand champ (verger) , des terrains et importer des produits agricoles , cela avec le soutien d’une Institution financière comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Mr. Mbaye, a married father, has been trading for 5 years. He lives about 40 km from the main town of this area in the west of Senegal.

His business is selling onions. He buys a fairly large amount to store and sell later, when prices are rising.

This is his first loan, and given his ordering capacity IMCEC entrusted him with this amount

He plans to acquire a large field (orchard), plots of land and import agricultural products, all with the support of a financial institution such as IMCEC.

loans.use: buy onions to store and resell later.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida es una señora preocupada por la salud de los demás, como profesión es auxiliar  de enfermería al servicio de un centro de salud de la zona donde habita desde hace 23 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. 

   Actualmente está solicitando un pequeño financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda la cual está en mal estado, y lo utilizara en la compra de perlines, cemento, arena, bloques, golosos, zinc y mano de obra de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que con mucho esfuerzos ha venido realizando dichas mejoras apoyada con los financiamientos, por lo tanto le agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo oportuno para realizar sus sueños, de esas manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
Cándida is someone who is constantly concerned about other people's health.  She is a nursing auxiliary at the health center in the area where she has lived for 23 years.  She is married and has two dependent children.

She is currently requesting a small loan to renovate her home which is in disrepair.  She will use the loan to buy beams, cement, sand, blocks, screws, metal sheeting and to hire workers.  This will improve her living conditions.  Through much effort, she has carried out other renovations through previous loans.  She is grateful to Ceprodel for the support in helping her reach her goals so she can lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy beams, cement, sand, blocks, screws, metal sheeting and to hire workers.

loans.name: Mario Santiago

texts.es:
Don Mario Santiago es originario de Masaya pero por circunstancia del trabajo se traslado a vivir a Managua, labora en una institución del estado, desempeñándose  como conductor desde hace catorce años, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, es una persona soltera que ha venido luchando por el bienestar de su familia. 

Se presento a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para construir un cuarto ya que la familia va creciendo y con este crédito se compra materiales  tales como cemento, hierro, arena y pago de mano de obra. 

Con este primer  financiamiento que Kiva- Ceprodel le  brinden le será de mucho apoyo, podrá darle un mejor  nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario Santiago is originally from Masaya but due to work circumstances he had to transfer to Managua where he has worked as a driver for a state institution for 14 years.  He is single, with two children in his care, and has struggled hard for his family's well being.

He is requesting a loan through Ceprodel to build another room since his family is growing.  He will use this loan to buy materials such as cement, iron and sand, and to hire workers.

This is hist first loan through Kiva-Ceprodel and it will be very helpful, enabling him to give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Elisabeth Gnima's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de 04 femmes qui sont issues du même village, très solidaire entre elles, ces femmes  jouissent d’une très bonne entente et d’une réputation de femmes travailleuses. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Elisabeth  (debout à gauche avec la main droite levée), est  l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 29 ans, malgré son jeune âge elle reste une femme très expérimentée dans l’activité d’achat et de vente de porcs. Elle est  mariée et mère de 02 enfants de 03 et 05 ans. Elle achète de jeune porcs auprès des villageois les engraisse pendant une quarantaine de jours pour la revente à l’état ou faire des abattages à l’occasion des fêtes et autres cérémonies religieuses. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter une quinzaine de porcs au prix moyen de 10 000 F Cfa,  les engraisser pour la revente moyennant une marge bénéficiaire de 20 000F Cfa par bête.

Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettront de participer très activement à la gestion du foyer et au renforcement de son épargne.
texts.en:
This group consists of four women who come from the same village.  They show great solidarity as a group, they get along very well with one another and they have a reputation of being very hardworking women.  Their main activity is small retail business.

Elisabeth (standing on the left-hand side and raising her right hand) is the group's featured borrower.  She is 29 years old.  In spite of her young age, she is very experienced in her activity, which consists in buying and selling pigs.  She is married and the mother of two children aged 3 and 5 years old.  She buys young pigs from the villagers, fattens them for about 40 days, and then resells them alive or slaughters them during the Holidays and other religious celebrations.

With her new loan, she will buy about 15 pigs at an average price of 10,000 CFA francs per pig.  She will fatten them for resale and make a 20,000 CFA franc profit margin per pig.

With the profits from her business, she will be able to take a very active part in the management of the household's expenses and she will also strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy about 15 pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy welding equipment and renovate his business location.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 43 años de edad madre de 5 hijos en un estado civil de unión libre con un grado de escolaridad cursado hasta el 4 grado. En compañía de su pareja y sus 2 hijos mayores se involucran en la agricultura en el cultivo de hortalizas, maíz, frijol y papa para generar ingresos para sus hogares. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde muy temprana edad ya que en su familia es una tradición trabajar la tierra y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a limpiar, sembrar e incluso el sistema de riego a implementar para las diferentes siembras. Las tierras que trabajan son propias adquiridas con mucho esfuerzo por muchos años las cuales están ubicadas enfrente de su casa de habitación. 

Doña María solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla de papa certificada para cultivar ya que esto mejorara la cosecha y dará confianza para plantar.

Sus sueños son que sus hijas terminen de estudiar y puedan graduarse de la secundaria ya que la carrera que están sacando es de técnicas en agropecuaria por lo tanto esto ayudara a implementar nuevas y mejoradas técnicas para poder cultivar una mejor y deferente variedad.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and a mother to five children.  She has a partner and completed up to the end of fourth grade at school.  With her partner and two oldest children, María works in farming, growing vegetables, corn, beans and potatoes in order to earn income for their respective households. María has been farming since a very early age as her family has a tradition of working the land and her parents taught her how to clean the land and plant the crops.  They also showed her the different irrigation systems that should be used for each product.  After years of effort, María now owns the land where she works, located across from her house.

María is applying for a loan to buy certified seeds to grow potatoes.  With these seeds, the harvest will be better and she will have more confidence in growing them.

María's dreams are for her daughters to finish their secondary education.  The are studying faring and this will help to implement new and better techniques for a growing a better and different variety of crops.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Julian David

texts.es:
Julián tiene 29 años de edad y se dedica al oficio de la confección desde hace algún tiempo. Cuenta que el negocio pertenecía a su hermano el cual le propuso trabajar juntos y posteriormente le dejó la totalidad del negocio. 
Asegura que hasta la fecha se siente muy satisfecho con los resultados obtenidos, pues el negocio se ha convertido en la fuente de sostenimiento para sus dos hijos y padres. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de  una máquina fileteadora industrial e insumos con el fin de remplazar una que se encuentra deteriorada por uso. Asegura que con dicha inversión mejorará tiempos de producción y aumentaran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Julián is 29 years old and has been working as a tailor for some time.  Before the business belonged to his brother but they now work together and Julián will soon own the whole business on his own.

Julián tells us that he is very satisfied with his results as the business has become a source of support for his children and parents. He is now applying for a loan to buy supplies and an industrial overlock sewing machine to replace his current one, which has become deteriorated through use.  Julián is confident that this investment will improve production times and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy an industrial overlock sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Iveth Del Carmen

texts.es: Ivett, tiene 32 años, junto a su pareja habita en el barrio memorial Sandino ambos procrearon 3 hijos siendo el mayor de 13 años,  su prioridad es darles una buena educación a todos, es por eso que trabaja a diario de sol a sol como ayudante de cocina en un bufete de comida, el crédito a solicitar es para empezar a hacer la construcción de mini falda de su casa que en la actualidad es de laminas de zinc y ella desea en gran  manera ir mejorando poco a poco su casa de concreto, lo que le permitirá sentirse más segura junto a sus hijos.
texts.en: Ivett is 32 years old and, along with her partner, she lives in the Sandino barrio.  Together they have three children, the oldest of whom is 13 years old.  Ivett's priority is to give all her children a good upbringing and so she works night and day as a kitchen porter in a buffet restaurant.  Ivett is applying for a loan to start building a new wall on her home, which is currently made of corrugated iron sheets.  Ivett would really like to improve her house, building it with concrete so that she can feel safer alongside her children.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, bricks and sand.

loans.name: Luis Holaya

texts.es:
Luis tiene 30 años de edad, y asegura que el mundo de la belleza, es una de sus grandes pasiones y en la actualidad su actividad económica. Realiza el oficio desde hace más de 13 años. Inició como empleado en diferentes salas de belleza de su localidad. Gracias a la experiencia y a las capacitaciones, Luis desarrollo su potencial y decidió convertirse en independiente. Hoy es reconocido en la zona por la gran labor que realiza. 
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en mejoras locativas con el fin de aumentar sus ventas e incrementar su número de clientes.
texts.en: Luis is 30 years old and tells us that the world of beauty treatments is one his greatest passions and is currently his source of income.  He has been doing this work for over thirteen years, having started as an employee in various beauty salons in town.  Thanks to his experience and training, Luis developed his potential and decided to become independent.  Luis is know well known in the area for the great work that he does.  He is applying for a loan to find better premises so that he can increase his sales and his number of customers.

loans.use: to find better premises.

loans.name: Odel

texts.es: Odel,52 años de edad, padre de tres hijos habita en la ciudad de Estelí  con su familia él se dedica a la elaboración de joyas de oro y plata desde hace mucho años  empezó lo hizo con ahorros que tenía compró las primeras máquinas con las que podría realizar este trabajo cuando era joven trabajo con familiares en este oficio el cual es su medio de vida y con el que ha preparado a  sus hijos ha tenido altibajos muchos obstáculos pero no se rinde ya que sabe que las cosas van a mejorar su meta a futuro es tener un lugar para su taller de joyería ya que en el lugar que estaba se mojaba y no tenía condiciones tuvo que cambiarse a su casa temporalmente su meta próxima es elaborar el pedido que tiene comprando el oro que necesita para lograrlo ese es su plan con este préstamo la compra de oro para hacer joyas  en este negocio cuenta con el apoyo de su familia sus productos los vende en la ciudad de Estelí.
texts.en: Odel is 52 years old and a father to three children.  He lives in the city of Estelí with his family and has been earning a living making gold and silver jewellery for many years.  He started when he used his savings to buy his first machines that he uses for this work.  When he was young, he worked with other family members in this same trade.  Odel earns his living with this work and he has brought up his children with it.  He has had ups and downs and faced many obstacles but Odel never gave up as he know that things would improve.  Odel's future goal is to have a place for his jewellery workshop as, at his last premises, the rain would come in and he is temporarily working from home.  Odel's immediate goal is to fulfill the order that he has.  He needs to buy gold for this goal.  Odel will use this loan to buy gold to make jewellery.  Odel receives support from his family with this business as they sell his products in the city of Estelí.

loans.use: to buy gold.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials (wood) wholesale.

loans.name: Maricella

texts.es: Maricela es una joven que busca como salir adelante y ayudarle a su madre con la obligación del hogar. Motivada por una amiga decidió iniciar en el mundo de la venta de calzado, lo que le ha permitido tener una fuente de ingresos y un mejoramiento en la calidad de vida. Con el propósito de crecer, Maricela se encentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de dos vitrinas y surtido, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos. Su mayor sueño es poder reunir el dinero suficiente para comprarle una vivienda a su madre y evitarle dolores de cabeza cuando llega la hora de pagar el arriendo. Asegura que ha pesar de las dificultades económicas que ha tenido que atravesar con su familia, es feliz porque gracias a Dios no ha faltado el alimento diario ni un techo donde albergarse.
texts.en: Maricela is a young woman seeking to get ahead and help her mother with the household obligations. Motivated by a friend, she decided to start in the world of selling shoes, which has allowed her to have a source of income and an improved quality of life. With the objective of growing, Maricela finds her self asking for a loan that she will invest in buying two display cases and some stock. This will allow her to increase her sales and have better income. Her biggest dream is to be able to save enough money to buy a store for her mother and save her the headaches when it comes time to pay the rent. She says that despite the financial difficulties that she has had to go through with her family, she is happy because thank God she hasn't lacked for food or shelter.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Rigoberto De Jesús

texts.es:
Rigoberto de 58 años de edad, inicio su negocio hace 20 años debido a su precaria condición económica y  a la necesidad de velar por le bienestar de sus tres hijos y esposa. Dedicado a la venta de dulces, cigarrillos y tinto de manera ambulante, este hombre ha sacado su familia adelante. 
Labora diariamente de 9:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm. En la actualidad presenta dificultades con las condiciones climáticas, ya que las lluvias que azotan por estos días la región le impide comercializar sus productos. Razón que lo ha motivado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una sombrilla y surtido, con el fin de continuar con el desarrollo de su labor. 
Sueña con tener un local para aumentar la variedad de productos y el número de ventas, mejorando así la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 58 years old. He started his business 20 years ago due to his precarious financial situation and the need to care for the well being of his three children and his wife. He works selling candies, cigarettes, and coffee as a street vendor. This man has been able to get his family ahead. 

He works every day from 9:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. Right now he has difficulties with weather conditions, since the rains that are coming down these days in the region stop him from selling his products. That is why he is motivated to ask for a loan to buy an awning and some merchandise in order to continue doing his work. He dreams of having a locale to increase the variety of products and the sales, thus improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an awning and merchandise.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando, tiene 40 años vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su pareja Herlinda de 40 años y sus dos hijos, él dentro de su localidad es considerado un hombre honesto y muy trabajador, que está dispuesto a sacar adelante a su familia a base de esfuerzo y perseverancia. Armando se dedica a la agricultura en terrenos alquilados, en estos terrenos cultiva papa, arveja y flor de gladiolos , además cría vacas, toros, carneros, cerdos y asnos. Armando desea sembrar en mayor cantidad para que obtenga más alimentos, asimismo espera instalar una tienda de productos comestibles en su domicilio, esto le permitiría brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus seres queridos.Éste es el tercer crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante.Armando, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Armando is 40 years old and he lives in a rented house with his spouse Herlinda, who is 40, and their two children. At his locale, he is considered an honest and very hard working man who is willing to get his family ahead with his hard work and perseverance.  Armando works in agriculture on rented land. On the land he grows potatoes, peas, and gladiola flowers. He also raises cows, bulls, pigs and donkeys. Armando wants to plant in greater quantities so that he can obtain more food. He also hopes to set up a store of food items in his house. This will allow him to offer a good quality of life to his loved ones. This is his third loan with KIVA and he is grateful for the financial support he has received. Armando will invest the S/.3000 soles in buying organic fertilizer to feed his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a single woman who has been working as a street vendor, selling clothes and shoes for women, men, and children since 2012. She has an established clientele.

Bintihamisi is requesting a loan to purchase jeans, clothes for men and women, and uniforms for elementary and high school students. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Bintihamisi dreams of expanding her business and become self-reliant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, clothes for men and women, and uniforms

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr: Madame Sanata est âgée de  59  ans environ, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle réside dans la ville de Koutiala chez son époux. Elle  n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis à bas âge. Elle exerce cette activité (préparation et vente de Sounbala) depuis plusieurs années, le Sounbala est l’un des condiments essentiels des femmes Maliennes. Elle est très sollicitée par sa clientèle, car elle reçoit des commandes importantes à travers le sous régions du Mali, pour cela cette activité est beaucoup prometteuse. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et élargir son activité, Elle a sollicité le partenariat avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 8 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié des prêts dans le groupe (prêt solidaire) et elle est à son 6ème prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 15 sacs de 100Kg de soja auprès des stockeurs de céréales de Koutiala, elle effectue sa vente après transformation du soja en Sounbala  à Koutiala, Bamako et Kayes, à une clientèle constituée de femmes généralement, au comptant et souvent à crédit. Avec ce prêt elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement de son prêt, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs, Sanata is about 59 years old. She's married and the mother of six children. She lives in Koutiala with her husband. She never had a chance to attend school, which is why she's been relying on trade since her youngest age.

She's been preparing and selling "Soumbala" (a condiment made out of beans, widely-used in West Africa). She's very much in demand from her clientele, and gets important orders from many different parts of Mali. Her business is therefore very promising.

To increase her working capital in order to meet customer demand and expand her business, she joined Kiva' partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, eight years ago. She already benefited from group loans (solidarity loans) and is now seeking her sixth personal loan. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

With this loan, she intends to buy fifteen 100 kg sacks of soy from cereals warehouses in Koutiala. She transforms the soy into "Soumbala" that she sells in Koutiala, Bamako and Kayes, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

With this loan, she counts on a monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200) that she intends to use to repay the loan and help improve her family's standard of living. She will reinvest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy soy

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Джамшед жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 34 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребёнка. Со своей семьёй Джамшед живёт в маленьком посёлке. Он очень любит природу и животных, поэтому занимается видом бизнеса, который ему по душе. Джамшед разводит скот, выращивает их и продаёт. Этот бизнес приносит ему стабильный доход.
 Жена Джамшеда нигде не работает, у неё достаточно хлопот по дому. А в свободное время она помогает мужу ухаживать за скотом. Соседи Джамшеда также занимаются животноводством и неподалёку от посёлка имеется большое пастбище, где все они могут пасти своих скот. Все соседи помогают друг другу в этом деле.
 Также Джамшед имеет дополнительный доход, он водит трактор и предоставляет услуги тракториста. У Джамшеда подрастает сын и скоро ему нужно будет поступать в Университет для получения высшего образования. Поэтому сейчас Джамшед желает увеличить свой бизнес, чтобы иметь достаточный доход для обеспечения своего сына. Он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для покупки нескольких голов рогатого скота. Джамшед надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Jamshed is a cheerful man of 44. He is married and has one child. He lives with his family in a small village. He loves nature and animals, and so he is engaged in the type of business that appeals to him. He breeds livestock, raises the animals, and then sells them. This brings provides him with a stable income.

Jamshed's wife does not have a job; she is busy enough at home. In her spare time she helps her husband tend the animals. All of the neighbors help each other in this business.

Jamshed earns additional income driving a tractor. His son is growing up and will soon need to enter the University. So now Jamshed wants to expand his business to earn enough to pay for son's education. He has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy several head of cattle. Jamshed is counting on a positive response and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married with six children. Although she has received no prior formal education, she is an entrepreneur who sells rice in Enyaadze, near Cape Coast. Abena has run her business for the past three years. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Abena is requesting a loan to buy more rice to sell to increase her business. In the long term, she plans to reinvest her future profits into her business to help her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Agé de 42 ans environ, Zoumana a deux épouses et est père de 3 enfants. Il vit  avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  Dû à des raisons sociales, Zoumana n’a pas eu la chance d’être instruit  raison pour laquelle il s’est basé sur les  activités  génératrices de revenus  depuis à bas âges. Il excelle dans les  activités d’achat et de vente des articles de boutique et de céréales qui lui procure assez de revenus, car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, il a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis plus 5 ans.  Il est à son 8ème prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition d’un stock de  diverses marchandises (huile alimentaire, sacs de sucre, de sel de cuisine, de lait en poudre, cartons de thé, et des sacs de céréale. Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à une clientèle mixte au comptant. 
Avec le renforcement de son fonds  de roulement, il compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, satisfaire les besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Zoumana, age 42, has two spouses and is the father of three children. He lives with his family in Koutiala (Sikasso Region). For social reasons, he didn't get the chance to receive an education, which is why he's been relying on money-earning businesses since his younger age.

He excels in buying and selling store products and cereals, a business which provides him with enough income, because he has a lot of customers every day.

To ensure his clientele is satisfied and expand his business, he joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago. He's seeking his eighth personal loan. The previous ones were repaid without problems.

This loan will be used to buy a stock of various products (cooking oil, sacks of sugar, cooking salt, powdered milk, boxes of tea, and sacks of cereals). He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Koutiala, and sells at his shop, for cash, to a mixed-gender clientele.

After increasing his working capital, he intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 300), to be used to repay the loan and provide for the needs of his family. The remainder will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, salt, powdered milk, tea, and cereals

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a married woman and a mother of seven children. She has been an animal trader for many years. Shehnaz initiated her business by buying animals to support her family. When she began, her husband was the only breadwinner in the family. Shehnaz buys baby goats and baby cows at low prices, rears them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. With the passage of time, Shehnaz's sales and income have increased. This expansion has happened due to her courage and determination.
