She and her husband live alone in her house and are involved in various farming activities together in the family because it's their only means of income.  She learned agriculture, planting and growing coffee, from a very young age thanks to her parents, who were lifelong farmers.  The land she and her husband farm is their own, from a family inheritance.  The other part they bought with the effort of their work.  The land is located on the same property where they live.

Currently she's requesting help to buy fertilizer and soil amendments to be able to take care of her own coffee crop to prevent deterioration of the product and loss of the bean.  This is the basis of her income for herself and her family.

Her dream as a mother is to be able to leave a small piece of land to each of her children as an inheritance so they can work and continue generating income for their families with well-strengthened assets to confront financial challenges favorably.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and soil amendments

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marilou would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Melinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy an additional stock of charcoal to be sold through her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of charcoal to be sold.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years, and earns more income from farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy an additional stock of vegetables to sell through for her buy-and-sell vegetables business. Amparo has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 3 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Razia is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Perigrena

texts.en:
Perigrena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns more income from her general store. Perigrena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она торгует мужской одеждой на одном из местных рынков. У нее есть в собственности свой киоск. Елена – очень трудолюбивая и ответственная. Она стремится постоянно развивать свой бизнес, постепенно улучшая благосостояние семьи.  
Елене необходима сумма в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонную мужскую одежду в ассортименте.
texts.en: Elena is a businesswoman from Melitopol, Ukraine.  She sells men's clothing at a local market.  She has her own kiosk.  Elena is hardworking and responsible.  She is constantly trying to expand her business, gradually improving the well-being of her family.  Elena needs 15,000 hryvnia to buy an assortment of seasonal men's clothing.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of seasonal men's clothing

loans.name: Felisberto

texts.pt:
O senhor Fesliberto tem 24 anos, vive maritalmente, tem 2 filhos menores e sustenta também a sua mãe, 2 irmãos e uma sobrinha.
Ele é negociante e tem uma barraca em Boane onde vende produtos alimentares e bebidas. Precisa do empréstimo para comprar produtos como refrescos, arroz e batata para revender na sua barraca.
Seu maior sonho é montar mais estabelecimentos comerciais de modo a aumentar as suas receitas para que possa dar uma vida condigna à sua família.
O seu maior desafio é cuidar da sua mãe viúva.
texts.en:
Mr. Felisberto is 24 years old, lives with his partner, has 2 underage children and also supports his mother, 2 brothers and a niece.

He's a trader and has a stall in Boane where he sells food and drink. He needs this loan to buy products such as beverages, rice and potatoes to sell on his stall.

His biggest dream is to set up more commercial establishments in order to increase his income so that he can provide a good life for his family.

His biggest challenge is to take care of his widowed mother.

loans.use: buy products such as beverages, rice and potatoes to sell on his stall.

loans.name: Faaea

texts.en: Faaea is a 44-year-old married woman with 10 children. She would like to start growing a vegetable garden to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, rakes, a wheelbarrow and a chain saw. She has been a member of SPBD for 3 years. Faaea will spend her profits to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, rakes, a wheelbarrow and a chain saw.

loans.name: Fuao

texts.en: Fuao is 32 years old, married, and has five children. She runs a small business, selling chicken curry with rice and barbeque in her community. She has been doing this work for many years. Fuao has requested a loan, which she will use to buy boxes of chicken, dripping oil, bags of rice, boxes of sausages, sacks of flour, soy sauce and an oven. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fuao will invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and an oven, for her prepared foods business

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria é negociante, tem uma mini-mercearia no quintal da casa e trabalha acima de 10 horas por dia durante toda semana. É casada, mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam o nível primário e secundário e vive na casa própria com o esposo e com os filhos que ela própria sustenta.
Com o recente empréstimo vai comprar açúcar, farinha, caldos, sabão e frangos para revender. No futuro pretende construir aviários para criação de frangos e para realizar os seus planos vai ampliar o negócio, liquidar o empréstimo, e solicitar outros.
texts.en:
Maria is a trader, has a mini grocery store in her back yard and works over 10 hours a day every day of the whole week. She's married, the mother of 4 children who go to primary and secondary school and lives in a house she owns with her husband and her children whom she supports.

With this loan she'll buy sugar, flour, stock, soap and chicken for resale. In future she plans to build chicken coops for the breeding of chickens and to make these plans a reality she will expand her business, pay off her loan and solicit further loans.

loans.use: buy sugar, flour, stock, soap and chicken for resale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
Angelina é solteira, vive na casa própria e mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais apenas uma ainda estuda.
Os fundos deste empréstimo serão aplicados na compra de cimento, blocos, areia e pedra para dar continuidade à construção de sua casa. No futuro pretende voltar a estudar, terminar a construção de sua casa e construir dependências para arrendar. Economizar mais o salário e fazer mais empréstimos serão os caminhos para concretizar os seus desejos.
texts.en:
Angelina is single, lives in a house she owns and is the mother of 4 children, only one of whom still goes to school.

The money from this loan will be used to buy cement, blocks, sand and stone to continue the construction of her house. In future she plans to return to her studies, finish building her house and build some smaller residences to rent. Saving up her salary and requesting more loans will be the paths to making her wishes come true.

loans.use: buy cement, blocks, sand and stone to continue the construction of her house

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Zaldy works hard to support his family.

He has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Zaldy is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fishing netting and other materials for his fishing business.

Zaldy has been sustaining his business activities through his past 12 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of building and expanding his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy fishing netting and other materials

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 49 years old, married, and has nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years, and she also earns income by fish vending.

Elvira requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to resell at her general store, like spices, eggs, soap and shampoo. She has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy items to resell at her general store, like spices, eggs, soap and shampoo

loans.name: Crisalda

texts.pt:
A Senhora Crisalda vive maritalmente e tem 5 filhos com quem vive.  
Com o empréstimo vai fazer instalação de energia eléctrica e comprar 3 postes de electricidade.
O seu maior sonho é construir uma mercearia em sua casa para poder fazer o seu negócio de venda de roupas num local com segurança e comodidade.
Seu maior desafio é a compra de material de construção dado o alto preço.
texts.en:
Mrs. Crisalda lives with her partner and has 5 children who live with her.

With this loan she is going to install electricity in her house and buy 3 electrical posts.

Her biggest dream is to build a general store in her house so she can continue her business selling clothing from a safe a comfortable location.

Her biggest challenge is buying construction material at such a high price.

loans.use: install electricity in her house and buy 3 electrical posts

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin has an established business he has owned for three years, performing outdoor construction; creating decks, patios, arbors, verandas, gazebos, fountains, fire pits, outdoor kitchens and more. Operated by only himself, Martin needed additional help and decided to hire two employees.

Through the funds of a $5,450 loan from Accion Texas Inc., Martin will hire a receptionist to stay in the office and a salesman. With his 15 years of experience, Martin strives to be the best at what he does, making his business motto: “We do it right, or not at all.”

Though his business is based out of his hometown of Spring, Texas, Martin serves all of the greater Houston area. View his website for photos on past work: http://www.sulliventservices.com/.

loans.use: to hire a salesman and receptionist.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 40 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling motor bike spare parts, which is the only source of income for the family.

Shabana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband's use. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of motor bike spare parts, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Shabana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her husband to have in stock, at his motorbike spare parts shop.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.pt:
O Senhor Lazaro é solteiro e vive com sua mãe e irmãos. Ele é órfão de pai e não tem dependentes directos.
Ele é fabricante de sofás e vai usar o empréstimo para comprar esponjas, napas, madeiras e tecidos para fabrico de sofás para vender, de forma a ajudar os seus irmãos e a sua mãe.
Seu maior sonho é construir casa própria e comprar uma viatura para transporte da sua mercadoria (sofás).
Tem como maior desafio empreender mais esforço no seu trabalho de modo a conseguir pagar o empréstimo que solicitou.
texts.en:
Mr. Lazaro is single and lives with his mother and brothers. His father has passed away and he has no direct dependents.

He makes sofas for a living and will use this loan to buy sponges, leather, wood and fabric to produce sofas to sell, so as to help his brothers and his mother.

His biggest dream is to build his own house and buy a vehicle to transport his sofas.

His biggest challenge is to make even more effort in his work so that he can pay off the loan.

loans.use: buy sponges, leather, wood and fabric to produce sofas to sell

loans.name: Eric

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Eric, quien con su credikiva compró maíz, papa, harina, arroz, y enseres como ollas y cucharas, con los que respondió a la temporada de ventas que se le presentó; al tener todo lo necesario para producir en mayor volumen,  aumentó sus ganancias pues obtuvo precios especiales y adquirió mas insumos, que lo que estaba acostumbrado a comprar. Eric dice a sus finaciadores: "Gracias por el apoyo brindado con el crédito, que le ofrecieron, pues fortalece su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el que comprará su materia prima e insumos en un volumen superior, como maíz, arroz, papa, aceites etc. Con ello aspira a obtener una vez mas nuevas ganancia, porque la producción la haría a un bajo costo y es que este es justamente, el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Eric, who used his Kiva credit to purchase corn, potatoes, flour, rice, and cookware like pots and spoons, all of which he used to respond to seasonal sales that presented themselves. Being able to have everything already ready to meet demand, he was able to increase his earnings because he was able to offer special prices and he acquired supplies he was not used to purchasing. Eric says to his financiers "Thank you for the support you have given me in the form of this credit" it has allowed him to strengthen his business. He is currently applying for a new credit with Kiva that he will use to purchase prime materials as well as wholesale supplies of corn, rice, potato, oils, etc. With this credit, he hopes to increase his earnings because he will be able to produce his product at a lower cost, this will be an example of how successful his Kiva credit will be.

loans.use: purchase prime materials and wholesale supplies of corn, rice, potatoes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis has been operating his business as a photographer, videographer and disc jockey (DJ) since the fall of 2006. As the sole employee of his business, Luis sometimes hires a temporary employee to help out once a month. As technology advances at an extreme pace, he needed to update his equipment. 

After he was turned down by a couple of banks, Luis was referred to the non-profit microlender, Accion Texas Inc. Luis then decided he would apply for a $5,450 loan to update his equipment and gain more customers through the better quality of service he will be able to offer. Luis says the loan will allow him to be actively competitive with the other photographers, videographers and DJs in San Juan, Texas. 

Without the loan, 34-year-old Luis says his business would halt in progression. As he is currently trying to expand the area he serves and the amount of clients he works with, the Accion loan will help Luis meet his pending business goals.

loans.use: to update his equipment.

loans.name: Marinda

texts.en:
Marinda is a 23-year-old woman who is married and has two children. She plans to start a small tailoring business.  

Marinda needs a loan to buy an overlock machine, materials, thread, and needles. She will use her profits to improve/extend her business. 

Marinda joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine, materials, thread and needles.

loans.name: Binga

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Binga works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling prepaid mobile load. Binga is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like noodles, eggs, sugar, milk, etc. for her general store business.

Binga has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like noodles, eggs, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days, Nabeela’s husband’s rickshaw is not working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Nabeela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Nabeela is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Vasila

texts.en:
Vasila works raising cattle that she fattens up, then sells in livestock and cattle markets. She also raises them to produce milk that’s then used to make dairy products, like custard, butter, and cheese. 

Vasila is 34, married, and the mother of three children. To help her husband, Vasila works hard to be able to provide their children's needs and schooling because she wants them to be educated and become professionals. Her family lives together with her husband's pensioner parents. She always wanted to be mistress of her own home. Together, they built a house, but it should be renovated and equipped with household needs. 

Vasila is asking for a loan of AZN 1,600 to purchase construction materials to start the repairs. They are grateful for this project and to the local communal bank for the opportunity it gives them to reach her dreams and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to start the home repairs.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Janeth has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from a general store. Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, four of whom are in school, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a meat-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice-retailing and raising pigs. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 23,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional meat to sell in her meat-vending business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell.

loans.name: Meki

texts.en:
Meki is 33 years old and married, with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for four years. 

Meki needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, and mutton flaps, a sack of flour, a bag of sugar, a bag of rice, a sack of onions, and a freezer. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's education. 

She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, and mutton flaps, a sack of flour, a bag of sugar, a bag of rice, a sack of onions, and a freezer.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 33 years old and married. She has three children, who are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for three years, and she earns additional income by keeping a general store.

Ligaya is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a Kubo Financiero client, this is her story.

"My name is Jennifer, and I am 30 years old.  I completed my studies at the Universidad Nacional Autonoma de México (UNAM) and became a dentist in 2012.  After finishing school, I opened a dental clinic in my neighborhood.  I will use this loan to buy x ray equipment.  The equipment costs about $2,050 US, but I will complement the loan with some savings that I have.  With the new equipment, I will be able to generate additional income because I currently have to send my clients to other places to make their radiographies.

I would like to share with you that I am married to Jesus, who works as a baker.  We have a daughter called Maria Fernanda that is one year and 9 months old.  We live in a rented house. 

My biggest accomplishment is that I finished both dentistry and nursery school.  I consider myself a great dentist - I started my clinic and have recurring clients. My next goal is to own a house and continue my education."

loans.use: To buy X Ray equipment for her dental clinic

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a Kubo Financiero client. This is her story.

"My name is Ruth and I am 39 years old.  I live in a house in San Miguel Teotongo with my parents, my husband and my son.  My husband works as a security guard, and we have two sons ages 11 and 21.  The oldest is already married.

I started my business 18 years ago - it's a gift shop called Regalos Ruth.  I usually sell in installments, as most of my clients can't afford to pay up front.  They pay me on a weekly basis.  Most of my clients always pay on time and many times they refer me to some of their friends.  I started the business to help my husband when we had two small kids.  With his income alone we couldn't afford our basic needs, so I started selling outside my parents house.  Fortunately sales grew and I was able to rent a small shop space.

My biggest accomplishment has been to own a house and buy a car.  My next step is to buy some furniture for my house."

loans.use: To buy kitchenware, blenders, irons and other home products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries to diversity the she offers her customers.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Daniela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pollos, venta de comida, venta de chicharron, costura, venta de fruta, venta de fundas para movilidad, venta de cosméticos, costura de pantalones, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Daniela es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de  su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CD’s; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, al observar que el producto era muy comercializado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de CD’s) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras por mayor de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, el crédito, la capacitación y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Flor Naciente" communal began will begin its sixth cycle with "Pro Mujer", through the Los Andes central office.  The group is made up of nine members and is directed by a board, which is headed the the president, Daniela.  The members of the communal bank have businesses working in different areas including: selling chicken, selling meals, selling pork, dressmaking, selling fruits, selling cosmetics, producing trousers, selling CDs and more.

This loan will benefit small businesses in the communal bank, which Daniela is a part of.  Daniela tells us that she herself joined "Pro Mujer" three years ago following an invitation from her mother, who is a member of the institution.  Daniela currently has a business selling CDs and she tells us that she started this business with her own initiative after she saw how well CDs were selling.

This loan will be used to increase her working capital by buying CDs in bulk from distributors at markets in the city of El Alto.  Daniela will then sell them from her own stall.  This types of work allows Daniela to earn money to support her household as best as possible.  She is married and has one son.

When asked what she likes about "Pro Mujer" Daniela says that she likes that she can save and borrow; she also likes the training and health advice provided.

loans.use: to buy CDs.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 37-year-old, married mother of three children. She owns a small business, where she sells physiotherapy kits for the disabled. She has been working in this field for 15 years. Her husband works on construction sites, in the field of concrete. Two of her kids are enrolled in private schools so that their future might be brighter than that of their parents. However, this also means that she has to settle the schooling tuition on top of the other expenses.

Lina is a very ambitious person and is very dedicated and passionate about her work. This is why she decided to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to purchase new physiotherapy kits that are more advanced than the ones she has been selling, and in order to replace her machines with new ones. As for the future, Lina wishes to expand her business to be the number one in her region.

loans.use: to purchase new physiotherapy kits that are more advanced than the ones she has been selling

loans.name: Ashurali

texts.ru: Ашурали 40 лет. Он работает электриком в своем районе Гиссар. У него жена и четверо детей. Его жена занимается продажей фисташек на рынке. Ашурали как глава семьи намерен увеличить семейный доход и с этой целью начать новый бизнес. Он выбрал направление пчеловодство. Его дом и участок земли находится в удаленном месте, где нет промышленных предприятий, фермерских угодий, или каких-либо пасек, то есть это очень хорошее место для разведения пчел. Ашурали имеет несколько домиков для пчел. Раньше он занимался этой деятельностью и имеет хороший опыт. Сейчас он хотел бы заново начать и расширить эту деятельность. Ашурали нуждается в кредите для покупки пчел и ульев. Закупив их, он мог бы приступить к делу.
texts.en: Ashurali is 40 years old. He works as an electrician in the Gissar region. He has a wife and four children.  His wife sells pistachios at the market. As the head of the family, Ashurali aims to increase the family's income by starting a new business. He has chosen to go into beekeeping. His home and plot of land are located in a distant area, where there are no industrial enterprises, farmland or apiaries, which makes it a very good place to raise bees. Ashurali has several houses for bees.  He has engaged in this trade before and has good experience. Now, he wants to restart and grow his business. Ashurali needs a loan for the purchase of bees and beehives.  Once he buys them, he can begin his business.

loans.use: To purchase bees and beehives

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is thirty-four year old and married to Grace. For the past three years he has run a food kiosk and makes a monthly income of 26,000 KES.

This will be Charles' second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use all of this 53,000 KES loan to buy supplies like rice, flour, sugar, etc. in bulk. In the future he wants to own a hotel and employ more people.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, flour, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is thirty years old and married with two children. She has farmed rice for three years now and also earns additional income from selling prepared food.

Lorna is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer, pesticides and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Ernestina, quien con su credikiva incrmentó el valor de sus compras y pudo responder a su clietnela en sus pedidos de ropa y calzado. Con su credikiva obtuvo una mayor rentabilidad y pudo ofrecer mejores precios, ampliando las perspectivas de su clientela y ensanchando mucho mas su egocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a uun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará : carnes frias, además de ropa y calzado con lo que surtirá su vitrina y con ello, una vez mas, planea hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Ernestina is thankful for the support.  With her Kiva loan, she increased the value of her purchases and was able to respond to her customer's orders of clothing and shoes.  She earned higher profits with her Kiva loan and was able to offer better prices, which expanded her customer prospects and expanded her business.

Currently she is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase cold meats, clothing, and shoes that she will use to stock her display case.  Once again, she plans to make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise including cold meats and clothing and shoes to stock her display case.

loans.name: Nueva Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NEUVA FORTALEZA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cepillos, venta de ropa, venta de celulares, elaboración de mandiles, venta de pitas, venta de chompas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mónica es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de  una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, hace diez años atraz.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá, por mayor, de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en los departamentos de Santa Cruz y Cochabamba; además en el país de Perú. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Fortaleza" communal bank began will begin its second cycle with "Pro Mujer", through the Los Andes central office. The group is made up of nine members and is directed by a board, which is headed by the president, Mónica. The members of the communal bank have businesses working in different areas including: selling chicken, selling items such as clothes, brushes, mobile phones, pita fibres and meals, as well as businesses making aprons.

This loan will benefit small businesses in the communal bank, of which Mónica is a part. Mónica tells us that she herself joined "Pro Mujer" six months ago following an invitation from her friend, who is a member of the institution. Mónica currently has a business selling clothes and she tells us that she started this business ten years ago through her own initiative.

This loan will be used to increase her working capital by buying clothes in bulk from distributors at markets in the city of El Alto. Mónica will then sell them in the Santa Cruz and Cochabamba departments, as well as in Peru. This type of work allows Mónica to earn money to support her household as best as possible. She is married and has one son.

When asked what she likes about "Pro Mujer" Mónica says that she likes the health advice that is provided.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Masela

texts.en: Masela is a 23-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community, to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Masela needs a loan to buy a box of chicken, mutton, sausages, soy sauce, a sack of potatoes, a bag of rice, and gas for the barbeque oven. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Masela has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, mutton, sausages, soy sauce, a sack of potatoes, a bag of rice, and gas for the barbeque oven.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 34 years old, married to Irene and the father of a much-loved child. He makes beauty supplies like hair products, creams, etc. He has been in this business for nine years and makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This will be Daniel's first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use this 30,000 KES loan to buy supplies for making hair oil. In the future he wants to improve his family’s living standards and grow his business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making hair oil

loans.name: Mirshakar

texts.ru: Миршакар родился в сельской местности. Миршакар добросовестный и трудолюбивый юноша. После окончания школы помогал отцу по скотоводству и выращиванию сельхоз культур. Через некоторое время поехал в Россию на заработки, проработав там 1 год, приехал обратно домой и купил автомашину марки «Волга 3110», которым он начал работать таксистом.  Позднее он начал бизнес по купле продажи фруктов и овощей. В ИМОН Миршакар обратился за займом в первый раз для расширения своего бизнеса по купле продажи фруктов и овощей. По словам Миршакара он в Российской Федерации занимался куплей- продажей фруктов и овощей и имеет опыт в данной отрасли. Миршакар планирует, купить оптом фрукты и овощи и продать их у себя в кишлаке по розничной цене.
texts.en: Mirshakar was born in a rural area. Mirshakar is a conscientious and hardworking young man.  After finishing school, he helped his father raise livestock and grow crops. After some time, he went to Russia in order to work.  After working there for a year, he returned home and purchased a car model called "Volga 3110", which he used to start working as a taxi driver. Later, he started a business selling fruits and vegetables. He has requested a loan from IMON for the first time in order to expand his business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables. Mirshakar says that, while he was in Russia, he bought and sold fruits and vegetables and has experience in this industry.  Mirshakar plans to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale, and then sell them in his village at retail prices.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en la ciudad de Guayaquil. Comenzó su negocio cocinando para sus vecinos. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos es por eso que comenzó a vender otros tipos de almuerzos. 

En la actualidad tiene un pequeño restaurante donde vende los almuerzos a $ 2.25 c/u. Trabaja desde las 10:00am hasta las 15:00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando aunque una de sus dificultades es que es pvvs (persona viviendo con vih sida). 

Quiere seguir incrementando sus ingresos por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo víveres para poder hacer almuerzos variados comprando legumbres, carnes, granos, etc. En su futuro quiere seguir con su negocio y con la ayuda de Dios tener mas salud y poder así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business by cooking for her neighbors.  Little by little, her income was improving.  Therefore, she started to sell other types of lunches.

She currently has a restaurant where she sells lunches for $2.25 each.  She works from 10:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. every day.  She has a lot of aspirations with her business.  That is why she wants to continue working, even though one of her difficulties is that she is a PVVS (person living with HIV/AIDS).

She wants to continue increasing her income.  That is why she wants to use the loan to buy supplies in order to be able to make varied lunches.  She will buy vegetables, meat, and grains, etc.  

In the future she wants to get ahead with her business.  With God’s help she wants to be healthier.  This way she will be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, and grains, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who for the past five years has run a restaurant in the Philippines. She earns additional money by buying and selling beauty products.

Lourdes is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant’s dishes. She has sustained her businesses through her own efforts and the help of NWTF loans. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant’s dishes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian, a 32-year-old single mother of one child, has been selling belts, caps, etc. in Kangemi for five years now, earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000. This will be Lilian's first loan with KADET LTD with which she plans to purchase belts, hairbands, caps, etc. for resale. In future she wants to educate her child and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy belts, caps, slimming belts, etc

loans.name: Nelufar

texts.ru:
Нелуфар женшина в возрасте 37 лет, замужем имеет детей. Она живет в сельской местности Дж. Расуловского района. Нелуфар занимается торговлей овощей на центральном колхозном рынке. Этим делом она занимается уже несколько лет. Также у нее дома имеется две коровы. Утром и вечером она ухаживает за коровами,доит их а днем занимается торговлей. Ее коровы дают по 10 литров молока каждый день, все ее соседи покупают у нее молоко. Но торговля овощами дает ей очень хорошую прибыль. Она закупает овощи из другого рынка и продает по дороже в своем селе. Ее муж плотник но он находится на заработках в РТ. По возможности отправляет денежные средства своей семье. Нелуфар не смотря не на что старается делать все чтобы ее дети не нуждались не в чем. Она очень честный и отзывчивый человек. 
Сейчас Нелуфар нуждается в денежных средствах, она хочет закупить овощи.  От соседей она узнала что в Арванде выдают кредиты и решила подать заявку.  На полученный кредит Нелуфар хочет  купить овощи и расширит свой бизнес.
texts.en: Nelufar is 37, married with children, and lives in the rural J. Rasulov district. Nelufar has been selling vegetables in the central farmer's market for several years. She also has two cows, which she cares for and milks in the morning and evening. Her cows produce ten liters of milk every day and all of her neighbors buy their milk from her. She also makes money selling vegetables during the day, which she buys from another market and then sells at a profit in her village. Her husband is a carpenter who works away from home and sends money to his family when he can. Nelufar is an honest and kind-hearted woman who does everything she can to provide for her children. Nelufar now needs the funds to buy more vegetables. Her neighbors told her about Arvand and she decided to apply for a loan so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Fathiya

texts.ru: Фатхия живет на юге страны, в районе Шахритус. Она замужем и воспитывает троих детей. У нее сын и две дочери. Ей 29 лет. Ее муж работает в городе Душанбе. Сама Фатхия вместе с свекровью и свекром занимается сельским хозяйством. Она научилась этому делу у них и уже пять лет занимается растениеводством. Фатхия на небольшом участке земли выращивает зерновые культуры, в основном рис. Прибыль с продажи урожая является главным источником их семейного бюджета. Фатхия просит кредит и на эту сумму хочет закупить семена риса, минеральные удобрения и топливо. Она знает, что мир не без добрых людей и верит в поддержку.
texts.en: Fathiya lives in the southern part of the country, in the Shahrituz region. She is married and raising three children. She has a son and two daughters.  She is 29 years old.  Her husband works in Dushanbe. Fathiya and her parents-in-law are engaged in agriculture. She learned the business from them and has already been farming for five years. On a small plot of land, Fathiya grows grain, mostly rice. The profit she makes from the sale of her harvest is the main source of income for the family.  Fathiya has requested a loan, which she hopes to use to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and fuel. She knows that there are kind people in the world and has faith in their support.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Armando en su ebanistería, pues con su credikiva, pudo comprar madera, pintura, y pegante. Su producción fue mayor con el incrmento de su materia prima y así mismo logró responder a la demanda de articulos decorativos en madera. El negocio de Armando ha crecido y por eso ha sido contratado para prestar servicios de ebanistería en iglesias y colegios. El dice a sus finaciadores: " Gracias por su apoyo y ayuda", pues le permitió fortalecer su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una maquinaria cifin torno lijadora, que le ayudará a realizar su trabajo más rápido y mejor acabado, lo cual le garantizará a su vez tener clientes satisfechos y bien atendidos.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Armando in his cabinet-making. With your Kiva credit, he has been able to buy wood, paint and glue. His production was increased with the increment of raw materials, and he responded to the demand for decorated wood items. 

Armando's business has grown, and as a result, has been contracted to provide cabinet-making services in churches and schools. He says to his financers, "Thank you for your support and help," as they allowed him to strengthen his business. 

He is currently using a Kiva loan, through which he will buy a belt sander, which will help him work faster and finish better, which in turn will guarantee him well-attended and satisfied clients.

loans.use: to buy a machine belt sander.

loans.name: Delmis Leticia

texts.es:
Delmis es una mujer de 31 años de edad casada y de su matrimonio tiene un hijo el cual vive y depende de ellos en todos los aspecto ya que el es menor de edad. Ella curso hasta el 6 grado de educación primaria gracias al esfuerzo, apoyo por parte de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra en lo que es el cultivo y siembra de café pero como todo en la vida, su mayor desafió es mantener limpia su cosecha libre de plagas y de enfermedades que deterioren la planta y el grano como la roya.

Actualmente ella necesita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para dar mantenimiento y fortalecer la planta desde su raíz hasta el grano consiguiendo un producto final de calidad.

Sus planes es ampliar mas sus cosechas de café fortalecer sus plantas para así tener una excelente cosecha y generar ingresos para ella y su familia formando un capital con el cual ella pueda volver a re-invertir en sus cosechas y salir de sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Delmis is a married, 31 year old woman. From her marriage, she has a son, who lives with and depends on his parents for everything, as he is a minor. She studied to grade 6 of primary school, thanks to effort.

She was supported in part by her own parents, who taught her to work the earth in the cultivation and growth of coffee. But, like everything in life, her biggest challenge is to keep her crop clean, free from plagues and diseases which deteriorate the plant and grain like rust.

Currently, she needs help buying fertilizers and compost to maintain and strengthen the plant from its root to the grain, obtaining a quality final product.

Her plan is to expand her coffee crop further, strengthen her plants in order to have an excellent crop and earn income for herself and her family, forming capital which she can re-invest in her crop and leave her commitments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Kristian Amilcar

texts.es:
kristian tiene  22 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Desde muy pequeño aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su madre; ya que era la única forma de recibir ingresos económicos al hogar. Durante toda la mañana trabaja en la agricultura y por la tarde vende sorbetes en toda la comunidad, debido a que lo que más desea es brindar todo lo necesario a su hijo. Los cultivos los siembra en las faldas de un cerro, eso le hace más difícil la labor. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 6 sacos de abono, entre otros insumos agrícolas para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 metros cuadrado de frijol. Como se le dificulta mucho salir a comprar los insumos, con el préstamo los adquirirá de una sola vez y los aplicara en el tiempo y cantidades correctas. Su objetivo es construir una casa de ladrillo debido a que esta viviendo junto a su mamá.
texts.en:
Kristian is 22 years old, is in a relationship, and has a son. As a small boy he learned to work in agriculture alongside his mother, since this was the only way to make a household income. He works all morning farming, and in the afternoon he sells sorbet to the community, because what he wants most is to provide for all of his son's needs. He plants his crops on the slopes of a hill, which makes the work more difficult.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 6 bags of fertilizer and other acrigultural supplies to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of beans. Since it is difficult for him to get out to buy supplies, he will get them all at once with the loan, and he will use them at the right time and in the right amounts. His goal is to build a brick house, since he is living with his mother.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of fertilizer and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sitoe

texts.en:
Sitoe is 38 years old and married with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community.

In 2012 Sitoe joined SPBD to take advantage of their financial services. She is now applying for a 1000 WST loan to buy an oven, frying pan, a bag of flour, oil and a sack of sugar. Sitoe hopes that in the future she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a pancake business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 49 years old and married with five children. She has sold charcoal for ten years and earns additional money from a small general store. She works hard to provide for her family.

Perlita has already borrowed and paid off fourteen loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She aspires to save enough money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sack of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en la ciudad de Guayaquil. Empezó hace dos atrás con una pequeña lavadora de carros. Comenzó con la ayuda de su tía quien lo ayudo a financiarse ya que el necesitaba un ingreso para poder mantener a su familia. Poco a poco fue mejorando los servicios que daba lavando los carros que pasaban por el pequeño local que pudo alquilar para su lavandería. 

En la actualidad el trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 22:00pm todos los días. Cobrar por cada lavada de carros un valor de $ 4.00 y según sea el lavado cobrar un aumento al pago original. Una de las dificultades que tiene es que a su edad es pvvs(persona viviendo con vih sida) pero a pesar de su enfermedad el es un joven muy emprendedor que quiere seguir progresando. 

El con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales como cemento, metal, piedras para construir en una parte de su lavanderia de carros una lubricadora y asi darle mejor servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The client lives in the city of Guayaquil.  He started two years ago with a small car wash.  He started with help from his aunt who helped him financially.  He did this because he needed an income in order to be able to support his family.  Little by little, he was improving the services he provided.  He was washing the cars that passed by the small place that he was able to rent for his washing services.

He currently works from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. every day.  He charges $4.00 to wash each car, and he charges more for other than the basic wash.  One of the difficulties that he has is that he is a PVVS (person living with HIV/AIDS).  However, in spite of his illness, he is a very enterprising young man who wants to continue making progress. 

He wants to use the loan to buy materials like cement, metal, and stones in order to build an oil change station at his car wash.  This way he will provide his customers with better services.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, metal, and stones.

loans.name: Sadagat

texts.en:
Sadagat, 49, is retired and on disability, married and the mother of two children, a son aged 25 and daughter aged twenty. She is a hardworking woman who dedicates herself completely to her family and her business selling women’s clothing and accessories.

Sadagat’s daughter is getting married. According to the custom in Azerbaijan, when a daughter is to be married a dowry such as furniture, appliances and other needed items is part of the marriage arrangement. How much the dowry is depends on the financial status of the daughter’s parents.

Sadagat is applying for a 1000 AZN loan to provide her daughter with a dowry of furniture. The loan will also be used to cover wedding expenses.

loans.use: To support her daughter with a dowry and cover wedding expenses.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a woman of thirty-three years, married to Joseph and a mother of two lovely children. She runs a beauty salon in Kangemi and has been in this business for five years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000.

This will be Alice's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy beauty products like hair oil, shampoo, etc. In the future, she wants to own a bigger salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Toese

texts.en:
Toese is a 30-year-old woman who is married and has two children. She plans to start a small business, which is painting different designs on clothes. 

Toese needs a loan to buy paints, brushes, elei design board (for imprinting designs), and materials for her business. She will use her profits to improve her business in the future. 

Toese joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, brushes, elei design board, and materials.

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
Sabiha is 30 years old, and she lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a member of a wedding band. His job is seasonally-based, and in the off season he has to face a lot of financial problems. This job is the only source of income for the family. However, his monthly income is inadequate for the household's needs.

Sabiha has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to purchase a band member uniform. They are going through a very difficult time because of low income. Sabiha is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a band member uniform for her husband, who is a musician

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years, and she earns additional income by fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more dried fish to sell. Mylene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN FRANCISCO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de herramientas, artesanía, venta de ropa, producción de folders de plástico, tejido de awayos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eva es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de herramientas de construcción; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de una amiga y está trabajando en el mismo hace ocho años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra herramientas de construcción) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener sus estudios pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Francisco will start the first cycle at Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of which Eva is the president. The communal bank's businesses are varied and include: tool sales, crafts, clothing sales, production of plastic folders, and weaving traditional blankets.

The loan requested will benefit the small businesses where Eva is a member. It is her first time joining Pro Mujer, which she does through an invitation from a promoter of the institution that visited her at home. Currently, she has a business selling construction tools, which she undertook on the recommendation of a friend; she has now been doing it for eight years.
 
The loan requested is to increase capital (purchase construction tools), that she will acquire from distribution companies and then sell in her space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her studies because she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy construction tools.

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia is 41 years old and married. She has one child. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, cucumbers and other vegetables, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this work for two years.

Silia needs a loan to buy fertilizer, some water hose, a backpack sprayer, garden spade and wheelbarrow, for her vegetable-growing business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Silia will use the profits from her sales to build a greenhouse for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, some water hose, a backpack sprayer, garden spade and wheelbarrow, for her vegetable-growing business

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Lita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. 

Lita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional recycled materials to sell for her recycled materials business.

Lita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.ru: Муминджон живет в селе Пахтаообод, джамоате Узун района Дж.Руми с женой и родителями. Ему 37 лет. Он со своей семьей занимается сельским хозяйством. Муминджон решил начать новый бизнес, чтобы улучшить условий жизни семьи. Он намерен заняться овцеводством. У него имеется сарай для содержания скота, стартовый капитал в размере 450 TJS, а также корм для овец из листьев, стеблей и початок кукурузы. Он планирует закупать по 4-х голов овец и после одного месяца откорма, продавать с наценкой на рынке. Однако чтобы закупить овец и приступить к делу он нуждается в необходимой сумме. Для осуществления цели он обратился за кредитом и просит поддержки.
texts.en: Muminjon lives in the village of Pahtaobod, in the Uzun collective area, J.Rumy region, with his wife and parents. He is 37 years old. He and his family members are engaged in agriculture. Muminjon has decided to start a new business, in order to improve the living conditions of his family. He plans to become a shepherd. He has a barn for keeping livestock, 450 TJS in start-up capital, as well as food for the sheep such as leaves, stems and corn husks. He plans to purchase 4 heads of sheep and, after feeding them for one month, sell them for a profit at the market. However, he needs a certain sum of money in order to purchase sheep and start the business. To realize his goal, he has requested a loan and is asking for support.

loans.use: To purchase sheep to fatten and sell

loans.name: Merabo

texts.en:
Merabo is a 25-year-old mother from Kanyamkago location in Migori County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Mr. John, who is a farmer and also supports family. She has two children who are eight and three years old respectively.

She operates a small retail shop within her location, and has been doing this for the last three years. She comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 9,000. She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD and will use the loan to purchase items like sugar, cooking oil, cooking fat, maize flour and salt for her retail shop. 

Merabo will use the anticipated profit to purchase farm inputs and venture into farming as the new business. Her dream is to become a successful farmer and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar, cooking fat, cooking oil and maize flour.

loans.name: Jose Emiliano

texts.es: Don José, de 39 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles sur, el tiene muchos años de trabajar en construcción, labor con el que ha mantenido a su familia, siendo el único que trabaja paga los gastos básicos, la esposa es ama de casa y vela por el bienestar y orden del hogar, ambos procrearon 3 hijos siendo el mayor de 13 años a quienes apoya para que estudien y que se puedan valerse solos en un futuro. El crédito solicitado es para ir haciendo el muro perimetral de su vivienda que está cubierto por viejas laminas de zinc, para él esta mejora es necesaria e importante porque garantizara la seguridad de sus hijos.
texts.en: Thirty-nine-year-old José lives in the south Laureles neighborhood. He has been working in construction for many years, work that has allowed him to support his family, as he is the only one that works to cover the basic expenses. His wife is a homemaker and looks after the well-being of the home. They have three children, the oldest of which is 13 years old, whom they support so that they can study and take care of themselves in the future. The requested loan is to work on the wall surrounding their home, which is covered with old metal sheets. He believes this improvement is necessary and important because it will guarantee his children's safety.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Mahmud Yogi

texts.en:
Yogi has a great interest in multispecies education, which teaches how to live in a bio-diverse world. He runs a foundation that teaches multispecies education and environmental sustainability. To teach people about green lifestyle, he set up an organic market. His small shop sells organic and natural products, and technologies that support green living.

With a high demand for simple, eco-friendly technologies, Yogi is going to use the loan to increase his inventory and add more varieties of green technology products such as solar lights, water filters and clean cookstoves. By expanding his business, he hopes he can spread the word to more people about the importance of environmental sustainability.


Yoga is positive, responsible and offers good quality customer service.

loans.use: to buy more green technologies for his Technology Kiosk

loans.name: Sumarti

texts.en:
Sumarti dreams of seeing her four children graduate from high school, although she herself only studied until the sixth grade. She works to realize this dream by selling cooked food and other small items from her stall.

Unfortunately health problems limited the time she could spend preparing food at night, reducing the variety of products she could sell. This affected her daily sales volume. She had the same amount of responsibility to support her family, but now with a lower income. 

However, Sumarti is a tenacious woman, a positive person who is open to new opportunities. She wanted to expand her business, and saw a market for selling simple, green technologies such as water filters, solar lights and clean cookstoves. 

Sumarti will use the loan to purchase the technologies and set up a technology kiosk, making clean water and alternative energy available in her community. 

Sumarti is very enthusiastic about the project. With the help of her daughter, Sinta, who is majoring in accounting at a vocational high school, they will serve as many customers as possible. This is also a learning opportunity for Sinta who will handle the orders and bookkeeping.

loans.use: to buy more green technologies for her tech kiosk

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell seedling tree business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional seeds to sell for her buy-and-sell seedling tree business.

Rosalie has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables and buy-and-sell rice grains.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a businesswoman. She is married to a mason. They have eight children, all of whom attend school. 

She began in sales, thanks to help from her husband. Little by little, Mwanamvua began increasing her sales since she goes out to offer her products in the zone. She sells mostly clothing for women and children, like blouses, shorts, undergarments, t-shirts, and sweatshirts. One of her great dreams is to have her own store in town. 

Mwanamvua is asking for a loan to purchase seasonal clothing. This will help her greatly with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Darío Esau

texts.es:
Darío tiene  47 años de edad, esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a sembrar maíz y frijol; este trabajo lo aprendió desde muy joven, debido a que su padre no lo envío a la escuela. Por esa razón, solo se dedico a cuidar animales y a cultivar. Los cultivos los realiza en las faldas de un cerro, los fertilizantes y otros insumos los tiene que cargar en su espalda ya que las calles son de difícil acceso y no entra vehiculo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 5 sacos de abono, entre otros insumos agrícolas para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrado de fríjol. Con el préstamo, pretende adquirir de una sola vez los insumos y aplicarlos en el tiempo y cantidades correctas. Su objetivo es construir una casa de ladrillo debido a que en la que vive es de adobe y se encuentra en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Darío is 47 years old. He is married and has four children. He has made a living growing corn and beans for the last 20 years. Darío began learning about farming at a very young age because his father did not send him to school. For this reason, Darío works raising animals and farming. He plants on the slopes of a mountain. He carries fertilizer and other supplies up on his back because the streets are not maintained and vehicles cannot pass. 

Darío is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and other farming supplies to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans. With the loan, he will be able to buy everything he needs at once and use them it the appropriate time and quantities. Darío's goal is to build a house made of brick because the one he has currently is made of adobe and in very bad condition.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer and other farming supplies to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans.

loans.name: Atene

texts.en:
Atene is a 21 year old married woman with two children.  She would like to start growing cabbages, beans, carrots and tomatoes to earn a living. Atene has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a file for knife sharpening, bush knives and a weed sprayer. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. 

Atene will spend her profits to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a file for knife sharpening, bush knives and weed a sprayer.
